Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: joejulie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located on the border between the center (dam square) and the jordaan. The hotel itself is just ok. Nothing special. The a/c is non-functionally as they are in the middle of a "soft" refurb. Luckily for us it was cold outside, but be sure to check before making a reservation when it's hot out. Also, this soft refurb ,add the water temperature jump 20 degrees and then drop 20. Hard to take a relaxing shower.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location but average hotel”
Reviews.Author: London_boy70
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is definitely the strongest selling point. it is right by Dam square, the nine streets and takes minutes to walk to the biggest landmarks in Amsterdam. The restaurant and bar area are nicely kept and were in keeping with the hotel atmosphere. It is all cleanly kept and in nice order. The staff were very friendly and welcoming upon arrival. The room was slightly above average, perhaps a little tired but very clean, with no real complaints other than the lack of 4* feel to it. if you can get a good deal on this hotel, i would recommend it, but if the price is of the same as other 4 or 5 * hotels, in that case weigh your options, locations and what you get for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mhazelton
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on two separate occasions, once for 5 days, the other for 3 days. Both stays were very pleasant. The hotel staff was very helpful. The best part about the place is definately the location. It sits only a block off of Dam Square and is at most a 20 minute walk from almost anywhere. We didn't use a train or taxi on either of our stays. The rooms are nice. Although the hotel is non-smoking, on our first stay there was a little bit of a smokey smell in the room, likely left over from when the hotel did have smoking. On our second stay there was no smell. The second room we stayed in had been renovated. We went in March when air conditioning was not needed, but I noticed that they are in the process of renovated the AC system. So if you're travelling in the summer that would be something to check on prior to booking. Overall, we a had a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: DavenCaff
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. The rooms were very nice and spacious. The only negative was that the lighting in the room was poor. The location is just perfect and a few minutes walk from the centre. We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Amsterdam. You can easily walk to the hotel from the train station (we were ripped off by the taxi driver when we arrived as were not aware how close we were to the train station). The taxi driver drove us around the block a few times and charged us 15 Euros. Great hotel, great location.

Reviews.Title: “Will Be Back”
Reviews.Author: Andrew N Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The only things we found wrong was the Spa bath did not work and also the TV we couldn't turn on or off. If elderly people stayed there they would not be able to get in or out of bath/shower.(Quite dangerous) But what a wonderful building and the square was great. Thanks for a good time. Viki & Andy

Reviews.Title: “Great choice of hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Chapel_lad
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night break. We originally booked it as it was the cheapest 4 star hotel in the area we wanted (and we liked the look of it). We had an internal room which was quiet and ideal for me as a light sleeper. There was no real view but then we were out most of the time we weren't sleeping. Location was ideal for all the main attractions with the Amsterdam Palace on your door step. The staff were friendly and helpful, rooms clean and the bar was cosy. Would be happy to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, smelly, tiny room.”
Reviews.Author: babissh
Reviews.Content: Great location but the room was ridiculously small. Felt like being squeezed in a closet. Surprisingly, the bathroom was fairly large though. Loads of noise coming from inside the hotel from other guests and staff alike. Seemed more like" port dive van cleve". Pre paid the room through Expedia and was not asked to leave a deposit like some other reviews state.

Reviews.Title: “Amsterdam at its best!”
Reviews.Author: xxLaniexx
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Die Port Van Cleve in Jan 2001. First impressions of the hotel... a nice clean lobby, friendly helpful staff (like most Dutch people). If you are looking for pure quality then dont stay here. However if you are looking for authentic quirky Amsterdam style this is the best place you could possibly stay! Upstairs was like a maze but we loved this, there was rooms going off in ever direction and little staircases and coves leading to rooms dotted about too. Please note... this hotel is not very wheelchair friendly. The room itself was outdated but VERY VERY cosy! The beds were really comfy too! The best thing about the hotel is it's location... right behind Dam Square which is a great base for your trip to Amsterdam. Nothing is far from here. This was our 10th trip to Amsterdam and our favourite expirence in a hotel so far (we sometimes rent apartments from the locals which is also a great way to spend your time in the city too!) The price was also really cheap for the location. Overrall a great trip and I would HIGHLY recommend the Die Port Van Cleve!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad and great location”
Reviews.Author: EmmaS1983
Reviews.Content: Staff were very friendly, if a little bit stuffy, the hotel is in a fantastic location which is why we decided to stay there, however the rooms were very noisey, we stayed in room 106 which faced out on to the main road at the back and were told after we mentionned the noise outside the window on the first night that no internal rooms were available. We could hear the toilet flushing in the next room and doors banging loudly late at night. As i said the location was fantastic and for the price you probably wont get anywhere as nice to stay that is so central. Its very close to Anne Frank House, main shopping area, red light district, madame toussauds, amsterdam dungeon, canals and tram stops, just dont expect a peaceful night.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Rita R Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Arrived early and hoped to leave our bags to book in later but were allowed to check in early. Fantastic after 24 hours+ of travelling. First room smelled of cigarettes but we were moved immediately to another. Room overlooked the St and was a bit noisy with Trams but we did not mind to much. Big Supermarket next door was handy and plenty of trams nearby to most locations.

Reviews.Title: “We couldn't have chosen a better situated hotel”
Reviews.Author: Michael G
Reviews.Content: It had friendly helpful staff. We had a very comfortable room on the top floor.Breakfast was included with our 4 night stay. We would certainly chose this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Dirty! & rude staff!”
Reviews.Author: Seanhil
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights (thank god it wasnt longer!) with my girlfriend, as most of the other comments say "upon arrival" looked nice, that lasted until the reception desk! Greeted by very snotty woman who quickly informed us we had to pay â‚¬100 deposit . .. Not like there was any thing valuable in the room! Room was small dirty stains on the walls, smelled bad but not as bad as the corridor! Narrow steep stairs and that was after you got the lift! And finally the WORST breakfast i have ever experenced in my life; cold, when its gone its gone, poor choice! Only good thing about this hotel is the location and the room was warm!

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: alan130960
Reviews.Content: this hotel, is situated 10 minutes from amsterdam central station, just off dam square, perfect location. the room was very comfortable, clean and completely adequate for a 2/3/4 night stay. hotel was clean, staff friendly and efficient. would definitely use it again. the breakfast wasnt included and was expensive, but there are plent of little cafes, coffee bars around that suffice. the hotel was very quiet even though it was on a main road.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: leeney29
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in feb, a group of 8 girls. We found the hotel an excellent location to Dam square for anyone looking to be central to a vibrant nightlife and all the culture amsterdam has to offer. Anne franks house, van gogh museum and what you expect to see during your visit here is on your doorstep. The staff were polite and helpful when approched but the bar often was missing a waiter and as all drinks are through table service you had to wait to order and also to pay. I was in a third floor room with 3 friends which was warm and spacious with a large bathroom. However our friends were in a suite on the 6th floor which was also spacious but quiet cold.

Reviews.Title: “great location for a great price”
Reviews.Author: lim09Munster
Reviews.Content: I have been to Amsterdam a few times, this is the best hotel I have stayed in for value for money. The last time I went I stayed in a 5 star hotel. Die port van cleve was half the price of the 5 star and the location was better. It has all you need for a weekend break to visit a fantastic city.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: HJS-2011-08
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night stay at the Die Port Van Cleve Hotel. After reading reviews about the hotel we were a little wary about our stay, however I am pleased to say the stay was very pleasant. The location of the hotel is great. Yes, the rooms are very small (at least the one we had was) and there was just a single wardrobe with 5 coat hangers to store our clothes resulting in us living out of the suitcase. Cleaniness is always an important issue for me and I was't disappointed although the toilet could have done with a drop of bleach. Our view from our room was other rooms, but this did not bother us too much. I am sure a room at the front of the building would have been better, but this did not spoil our stay. The reception staff were very helpful and polite and gave us plenty of advice. The bar was clean and a nice place to sit and have a quiet drink of an evening. Once again polite and helpful staff. We did not eat at the hotel as we did feel the prices were rather high. We did find a small steak resturant called El Rancho. It does look a dive I have to be honest, but we were very surprised by their very good value steak meal. It was very tastey, a good sized portion and served with a smile. Don't let appearences put you off. We did all the usual tourist things and on our last day took the bus tour of Amsterdam. This revealed several things we would have like to have visited but had now run out of time. So a tip would be to do the tour on your first day if it is your first visit to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: theshawsfromeccles
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant hotel in a good location close to Dam Square and all the attractions of Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “dave& sue sprason- brilliant staff nothing too much trouble”
Reviews.Author: davidsprason
Reviews.Content: my husband and i often go to amsterdam and stay at differant hotels but this one was by far the most welcoming. the first room we were given was too small so the desk changed it later that evening, no problem. 2nd rm brilliant . staff were extremely polite and showed how to get about in amsterdam tram tickets etc when the staff found out it was our wedding anniversary two free glasses of chgampagne were immediately ordered. the young man in the bar was very interesting and told us all about local buildings the palace over the road the churches and the history of the hotel etc he was very proud to share his knowledge of his home town! even though we only stayed 4 days the staff greeted us like old friends every time we came and went from the hotel asked us if we were having a good day and were we were going that night. would definately stay here again but would ask for a front room as it was bigger.

Reviews.Title: “Ideally located in the heart of the entertainment area and 5min walk from Central Station”
Reviews.Author: VanessaNarotam
Reviews.Content: This 4 star hotel is ideally located within easy walking distance from the Central Station and the vibrant nightlife. The Magna Plaza, a mall, is next door. Not great shopping, boutique stores. The rooms are a decent size, bathrooms small but clean. The hotel is quaint and was the site of the original Heineken brewery! The trams make all the neighbourhoods of Amsterdam easily accessible. The breakfasts were nice as well, in terms of variety and quality. The morning we were leaving we took the 6:30 am airport shuttle (16 euros). Breakfast started at 6:30 am. We were down by 6am and at about 6:10, we asked if we could get some juice and pastries or something. The lady in the restaurant rudely told us no, and we had paid for breakfast. From the airport to the hotel, we took the train, to Central Station (4 euros) and we took the number 5 tram which stopped right outside the hotel, it's the Dam square stop. If u r considering using the train, travel light.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't Even Make it Past the Front Desk”
Reviews.Author: benzer2
Reviews.Content: My buddy and I found ourselves in Amsterdam for a few days, and were looking for a place to stay. We are both members of the Canadian Forces and were on our Christmas leave. The location of the hotel attracted us first, as well did the outward appearance. However, once at the front desk we were turned off almost immediately. A simple inquiry about pricing and the possibility of a military discount was met with a hostile and undermining attitude. We were told that, "Discounts are unusual in the Netherlands, and maybe we should look in Canada if we want a military discount." We said thank you and left immediately after that. Perhaps our hiking jackets and jeans made us look a little too cheap for his tastes. I will never even think about going there again. The next hotel we called and the one we ultimately stayed at, Hotel Arena, offered us a sizable government discount and ended up being an awesome stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend”
Reviews.Author: JAYS28
Reviews.Content: First time in Amsterdam.Great hotel,great location,great place!

Reviews.Title: “great for city break”
Reviews.Author: 186346Carol
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 1 night on a p &o mini cruise on december 8th its in a great location just a 10 minute walk from the ferry bus drop off, and just cross the road for the dam,there is a supermarket along the road.Breakfast was included in the package I wouldn't pay extra for it.although it is buffet style, lots of cafes nearby.Room was spacious and on 2 levels overlooking main street. We were able to leave our luggage on day of arrival before we got into room and again when we left.Good location for short break I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Old hotel no breakfast but good location in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Mrmotomike
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here 3 times on different trips . The price has gone up and the service has gone down :( . The location is hard to beat . But cranky staff and no breakfast at 130.00 euros NOT SO GOOD ! I hope to find a better place for my Next stay in this enchanting city !! Amsterdam is one of my top 50 city's in the world . Alas the van Cleve will NOT be apart of my visit any longer .

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Andrzejsc
Reviews.Content: Location (the city centre) was one of the reason of booking this hotel.Walking distance ~10 min.from Amsteram Centraal.Room was small but nice and clean.Breakfest OK,for add. 12.5 euro pp.when order with reservation .All around good deal for $135 in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 Star!!!”
Reviews.Author: casey84
Reviews.Content: Well, On booking this hotel we thought we had a right gooden, being in a great location and looking greay from the outside! All went well until we got our room... Reception and outside is lovely but decieving!! We firstly got given a room in what seemed to be the basement.. we had to go doen some tiny steep stairs to find 3 rooms and a fire escape.. the walls and ceilings were paper thin and felt like we were going to fall through! Shabby and unloved.. Definetly NOT a 4 star! So we moved rooms.. it was better, as in more sturdy! But still quite small, dark and not luxurious.. also no fridge. On the plus side.. and the only plus side! The bed was very comfy! Prime location too! Weirdly they had an ironing room, where i had to expose myself while ironing the dress i wanted to wear! .. Like i said before. Great for location but i wuldnt stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Shoddy hotel - don't bother!”
Reviews.Author: Skapole
Reviews.Content: Upon first entering our room, we discovered it was tiny - very tiny. If we had had a cat, we certainly could not have swung it without hitting its head! We were in what appeared to be part of the attic. Considering we had booked many months before and had requested a room with a view over Dam Square, this was disappointing to say the least. I went down to reception to ask if they had any other rooms as ours was so awful, and they said they were full. Considering this was a Thursday night in early December, I find that hard to believe. The staff were very unhelpful and obstructive. I asked for the manager's name, and they refused to give it to me, which I thought was a bit odd. They said I could talk to him in the morning when he came in, but that was not going to solve the problem of being in a room not much bigger than a broom cupboard for that night. I have stayed in larger boat cabins than this. In the end, we did not bother moving. We were tired and were only there for 3 days anyway, so we decided to put up with it, but the staff's attitude was very disappointing. Some other observations about our room and the hotel: - There were two doors in the room, leading to the attic space around which cold draughts blew, making the room very cold. - The room was quite shoddy and tired looking and not particularly clean - Normally when you bump into the room maids, they are friendly, but not the one we saw - she had a very sour expression! One morning, we went to make ourselves a cup of tea and found that she had only put one clean mug on the tray, leaving the old dirty one from the day before - The hotel bar closed at 10.30pm each night, so we had to go outside for a drink, where there were lots of bars open. Seems a bit odd to close so early - The location is good, being only half a minute from Dam Square, so if you don't mind a poor quality room etc, it will be OK. Overall, this was a very shoddy hotel with unfriendly staff and a very small room and no view. The best thing about this hotel is the jar of mints on the reception counter, of which we had quite a few! Hotel and room - 1/10 Mints - 10/10! Says it all.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location and good facilities but shabby decor”
Reviews.Author: LMurphy2
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ideally located for the city centre. A short walk from the Centraal train station, right next to a tram stop, adjacent to a shopping centre and a stones throw from Dam Square and the red light district. We had a quiet room which overlooked an internal courtyard of the hotel but many rooms face out onto the very busy main road. It was incredibly busy when we arrived and our room was not ready until 3:30pm. However, the hotel provided a luggage storage room to keep your luggage if you arrived before your room was ready and also to store luggage on your day of departure. The hotel staff were very friendly and happy to provide info on the local area. The room was very clean but very dated. The walls were marked, furniture scratched, lamp broken and the tv rarely seemed to respond to the remote. The matress had 2 huge dents where people slept and it was very difficult to sleep comfortably without rolling down into the dents! This is definitely not comparable to what you would normally expect from a 4* hotel but I think the high cost is because you are paying for the perfect location. We just stayed in the basic double room which cost us $286 euros for 2 nights. I'd stay again for a city break, business trip or a holiday with friends but would not recommend this as a luxury or honeymoon hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Central Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rachelwales33
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in a twin room. Looks posher from the outside than it actually is but the rooms are really clean, fresh and bright. We had a shower over the bath and a hair dryer in the bathroom. The bedroom had a large window with a neat table and chair set in front of it. A kettle is provided along with a few tea bags, coffees and the such. Our room was at the back of the hotel facing out onto the university but we were never disturbed by this. The radiators were always on which was a welcome with it being a cold winter. The staff are really friendly and were always happy to help with directions and trams. Great location being right in the centre and having tram stops right outside.

Reviews.Title: “great location!”
Reviews.Author: clairelevitt
Reviews.Content: My colleague and I stayed here for one night, following a business conference. Check-in was efficient, and the staff very friendly. The room was small and basic, but perfectly adequate for our short stay; and clean. The beds were comfortable, and we experienced no noise from either the main street or other guests. Breakfast was very nice. The best selling point of this hotel is it's location - close to Dam Square, and only 5-10 minutes walk from Centraal Station. Personally, I would rate this hotel as more of a 3*+ than 4*, but would definitely recommend it as a base to explore Amsterdam...... at the end of the day, if I was on a city break I would only be using the hotel to sleep and shower, not spend all day in the room!

Reviews.Title: “Shoddy”
Reviews.Author: Christine B
Reviews.Content: We were booked this hotel as part of a P&O cruise package. When we arrived we were greeted by a surly receptionist who was at best disinterested with us. I expressed that we were there on our honeymoon and asked that we be given a nice room, which I would have expected from a 4* anyway. The room we were given was very basic, small and ugly - with a window that faced a wall. It had a wardrobe you couldn't use because it was blocked by a desk and the light switch was behind one of the pillows! The breakfast in the morning was very poor with what I can only assume was watered down juice and sub-standard food. At best I would class this as a 3* (and that's generous), I can only assume they base their star rating on the lobby rather then the hotel as a whole. The only possitive is the location, just off the square and round the corner from our coach pickup point. I won't be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: catherine191274
Reviews.Content: if you have not been to Amsterdam before it would be a really good place to stay because it is right in the centre of the city. The hotel it's self looks like a 4 star from the outside; however the rooms were very small, we could not open the bathroom door without banging the bed and it was basic but clean. The staff were very helpful and the breakfasts are very good. we had dinner in the bar one night and the food and service was brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “Back again”
Reviews.Author: UKDavidN
Reviews.Content: Just back from a further stay and this time in Room 103. Still undergoing a soft refurb so no air con (as the room was hot). Interestingly, this room had a card in which stated that it was a "blue delft" room which meant that the lampshade, pillow cases and bed cover were in this pattern but still tired old furniture. Same problem as last time (small wardrobe; no shelf in small desk so non-hanging clothes went on the bottom of the wardrobe. Luckily only me staying but would have been a problem for two people. Yet, pretty good bathroom and now free hi-fi in the rooms. Great location and star rating does not go off position alone. Reading more recent positive reviews agian indicates that the rooms vary - as I have said before :) - try to get one on the inside as no view also means no noise from outside as the rooms are not double glazed.

Reviews.Title: “Key location, amenities satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: Genevieve B
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in October 2011. I read some reviews here beforehand saying how disappointing it was because they expected more out of a 4-star hotel. I agree to some extent but I think the 4-star is more due to location. The hotel reminded me a lot of the ones in NYC-as you get closer to the prime location, the rooms end up being smaller. I don't have any real complaints. Yes the rooms are pretty small but they are adequate. The bed was comfortable, the bathroom was clean enough. Our priority was the location so I guess it depends on what's important to you. You walk out of the hotel and the trams are right across the street and the Dam Square is only steps away. We spent most of our time out anyway so it suited us perfectly. Staff was very accommodating especially since we left mid trip and came back. They had no problem taking care of our bigger luggages while we were away they are very professional. Overall a good experience and when I go back to Amsterdam, I will definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice experience”
Reviews.Author: Catherine49680
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Die Port Van Cleve in late September (2011). The room was small but clean and comfortable. The staff was friendly and helpful. The buffet breakfast (not included in the price of the room) offered a lot of variety. It seemed expensive until I saw how expensive the city is. The bar is attractive. The location was very good. Public transportation was a short walk away. There were a lot of shops and restaurants nearby. There was a food market about a block away. I was able to buy snacks and drinks there. My only complaint was that there was a fair amount of street noise at night, but that is part of being in such a central location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly fine for a central stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: gemzii89
Reviews.Content: Me and a colleague have recently returned from a 1 night stay in this hotel - extending our stay after a work convention on the river cruise ships. After reading some of the poor reviews - I must say I am really rather surprised as to how and why other guests have rated this hotel so badly. I can understand that this hotel is probably more suited to a 3* plus, rather than a 4* - however I believe the star rating is based on the location more than anything. The hotel was very easy to find, just off Dam Square, the hotel reception were very efficient and helpful, we stayed in room 229 - not much of a view out the window however it was dark when we arrived anyway. The room provided you with adequate facilites, functional and fairly modern bathroom, beds were comfy, free wifi for all guests in public areas and some main english channels on the television. The breakfast was in the Brassiere restaurant on the reception floor - Perfectly adequate to fill you up until lunch, offering Toast, Scrambled Egg, Bacon, Sausage and continental hams, cheese etc; The hotel were very helpful to store our luggage in a store room after we checked out so we didnt have to cart it around as we explored the city for the rest of the day. I absolutely loved amsterdam, would certainly recommend this hotel and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!! Even better location and very Comfy beds :)”
Reviews.Author: Hardygirl01
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a Young couple in Amsterdam! This hotel is fab location literally just off of dam square so right in middle of everything! Rooms were great, very clean and spacious! (we had a back room looking onto the road behind) the beds were out of this world and we are fussy with comfort but can not be faulted atall! Everything kept clean an receptionists always happy to help with whatever you need!! The only thing I will say let this hotel down is the breakfast to put it blunt it was a load of rubbish it is not worth the extortionate price they charge and not alot of selection! We booked breakfast as we arrived he made it sound like we would be paying about 15 euro for all 3 days when intact it worked out about 35 euro so if u do go for the breakfast check this when they make it sound cheap cos it more than likely ain't gonna be and the location u are in there are plenty of places to grab breakfast from. Other than that can not be faulted atall an would definitely stay here again!!! :)

Reviews.Title: “Take this bed to the Torture Museum, they have need of it there!!”
Reviews.Author: MrHays
Reviews.Content: VERY DISAPPOINTING. This hotel is in a prime location which is really it's only redeaming quality. I will say it was fairly clean. The rooms are TINY. The beds...well, there are not enough negative words to describe the lumpy lopsided sink-hole of a disastrous nights' sleep monstrously awful things they call beds. Upon my arrival, I was greeted with hair in the supposedly clean tub. I cannot possibly imagine how this hotel earned 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Big let down.”
Reviews.Author: WiltshireDruid
Reviews.Content: Hotel location is very central, near Dam Square, hence reason for booking via hotel's own website, 6 months prior to visit, and paying at time of booking. I had wanted to use visit to say a good "thank you" to colleagues. On arrival at hotel, they told us that despite having a confirmed reservation that they were full, and had re-sold our rooms, however they had booked us in to their "sister" hotel (The Artemis) and would pay for taxis to get us there. The sister hotel was a 25 minute taxi ride from the centre of town (near airport). At the end of a long business day and being tired, we had no option but to agree to their terms. It ruined the trip for me, my colleagues were polite but obviously disappointed. We had dinner in town, but spent over 1.25 hours in taxis that night. My impressions are that this is the not the first time that the hotel have done this, to help them "sell" rooms in their less favourably located "sister" hotel. I had confirmed the rooms by e mail 2 weeks prior to travel, so they had all my details and could have contracted me before I turned up on the night, they had no excuse in my eyes, and let down their customers. Beware when booking and paying up front, you do not always get what you pay for or expect. If you can, stay somewhere else they do not deserve business if they treat customers this way.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: masha_zec
Reviews.Content: positive: nice location, quiet rooms if not facing the street, working wifi and internet, comfortable bed negative: amenities not adequate for a 4 star hotel, rooms smell bad and occasionaly there is a sewerage smell coming out of bathroom pipes. did not feel clean. there is no mini-bar in any room. despite not having breakfast the personnel was not flexible to cancel those charges.

Reviews.Title: “Die Port Van Cleve - great location”
Reviews.Author: Lotte_ladybird
Reviews.Content: Having seen this was a 4 star hotel I expected a lot more from it. The building itself was beautiful and the lobby was nice too. The rooms were at best mediocre. Extremely small rooms (we had booked 2) - you could barely walk between the end of the bed and the desk to get to the window and other side of the bed. The bathrooms on the other hand were huge. So big that you couldn't reach the toilet paper from the toilet because it was on the opposite wall, a good 2 meters away. Not practical. Also, no ventilation in the bathrooms at all so they were smelling pretty musty. Had this been a rated a 3 star hotel it would have been perfectly fine, but as I said, I expected more. That said, the location was perfect. Everything is within walking distance and should you want a snack there's a great supermarket 2 minutes walk down the street. It's also easy to get to from the station and airport.

Reviews.Title: “Overdue for a makeover”
Reviews.Author: truview
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is very good - situated close to many of the city centre attractions The staff could not have been more helpful and pleasant. Breakfast was very good we did not expect bacon and eggs, and set us up for the day However the room we stayed in, although being very roomy, was way overdue for a makeover. The bathroom was not especially clean as the tiles were leaving the wall in places and the radiator was rusty!! The bedroom walls were damaged and black where suitcases had knocked them and the mugs were unusable as they were dirty. In summary if you are going for a short stay to view the main attractions of Amsterdam then this hotel is in an ideal location. If you are not happy with your room then complain I am sure the staff would be ready to help

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, shame about the rooms”
Reviews.Author: plod1127
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is 2nd to none - just behind the Palace in Dam Square. The front of the hotel is lovely and has a very nice, clean and modern looking reception with friendly and helpful staff, but thats where it stops. Like other Amsterdam Hotels I have stayed in, the general theme appears to be top class looking exterior then small, shoddy looking, musty smelling rooms in need of redecorating and refurbishing. This is a 3 not 4 star hotel. Despite my description of the rooms, this is a nice hotel and unless you are planning to spend lots of time in your room I would recommend this hotel if you can book a room for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located but poor otherwise”
Reviews.Author: pdid
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a quick 10 minute walk from the Amsterdam Central Station, which is ~20 minutes, 5 Euros from Schiphol Airport by train. The hotel's central location is the only thing this hotel has going for it. There are many shops, restaurants and cafes located at walking distance. The hotel also offers free Wi-Fi access. Front desk service was not good. I reached the hotel at 2:30pm and they made me wait for an entire hour before assigning a room. The building is ancient and elevators are really slow. The entire hotel is undergoing "soft renovations" and the air conditioning was not working. This was ok in early October as long as you can keep the window open. However, some of the rooms have no windows at all, so make sure they assign you one that does have windows. Sleep quality in this hotel was poor as the twin beds were uncomfortable and the noise from the street below was quite loud till at least 1am in the morning. Breakfast in their restaurant was plain average and cost Euro 19 which was very poor value for money. I would not stay here on my next visit to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “What you see is NOT what you get”
Reviews.Author: tatirlima
Reviews.Content: Their website is lovely and exciting but it is not even close to reality. My room was small and I could see mould in the bathroom ceiling. The staff, specially from the front desk, is definitely not friendly - exception made from one man, Karim, the only one really efficient. The others...do you know when you ask for information and the other person acts like you're asking a big favor? Well, that's what they make you feel from the moment you arrive. The location is good, but I'm sure you'll find some place better in the same neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Good Service, Average Rooms”
Reviews.Author: sambo_1986
Reviews.Content: We Stayed at the Die Port van Cleve hotel for 3 nights in August 2010. The hotel is located just behind Dam Square and there is a tram stop directly outside. The location of the hotel was great, it is within easy reach only a few mins walk from all the bars and shops in the Dam Square area, and is only a 5 minute walk to the main train station. Whilst we were there the hotel was supposedly in the middle of upgrading the air-conditioning so unfortunately the air-con did not work and because of the time of year this made the rooms very hot. The hotel advertised free wireless internet and although connection to the hotels internet was free it was not wireless and I had to plug an Ethernet cable in to my laptop to connect to the internet which was a disappointment. There is a good selection of English TV channels, notably BBC. There was no mini-bar fridge in the room which was also a disappointment. The public areas in the hotel and beautifully furnished and the restaurant and bar are also very nice, however I found the hotel room we stayed in to be a little tired / shabby in terms of furnishings.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough for a second stay”
Reviews.Author: Marnie09
Reviews.Content: We chose, through Air France Holiday Services, to stay at this hotel for the second year in a row. Our room on the 2nd floor was the same as the 6th with one main difference - we could not open a window. Without the fan, we would have been very uncomfortable. That said, the hotel/rooms are very clean; the staff extremely friendly & helpful; the buffet breakfast has a good selection with something to satisfy everyone; the attached bar is warm, friendly & fun in which to have a drink. The hotel is walking distance from the train station and located a block from the Dam, good shopping, cute cafes. Yes, the tram goes right in front of the hotel, but we prefer to stay in a room on the hotel front so that we can hear and see everything that is going on including the sounds of the tram.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: StevensFam
Reviews.Content: The best feature of this hotel is its great location followed by the friendliness and courteousness of the front office staff. They try to do their best but, unfortunately, I wouldn't rate it as a 4-star establishment. The features in the room are quite minimal - not much cupboard/drawer space, no minibar, only a shower cap and small body lotion offered (not replaced the next day), soap/shampoo dispenser attached to the wall, etc. Nevertheless, it was clean and the bed was comfortable enough. I was traveling with my small child and they offered a cot, which was very thoughtful but not necessary in this instance. The room was a bit noisy but that is to be expected given the prime location of the hotel (Dam Square). I was quite lucky to get a room as it was a very busy week/weekend in Amsterdam with one of the largest conferences taking place at the RAI. The rate, from previous research, might typically cost â‚¬170 per night, however, on this occasion the rate was â‚¬389...but they did give me a slight discount down to â‚¬309 per night excluding taxes. There weren't any hotel rooms available at much of a lower rate elsewhere to my liking so I bit the bullet and gratefully accepted what was available for the weekend. Under any other circumstances, this rate would not have been acceptable. The hotel was undergoing a soft refurbishment and offered a 25% discount on a lunch or dinner because the air conditioning was not working. They should have extended the discount for each night stayed rather than a one-off voucher. I had dinner in the restaurant one evening and the food was adequate. I ordered the numbered steak and it was fairly good. The service staff could have been a little more attentive but, again, it wasn't significantly bad.

Reviews.Title: “Looks like a backpacker's, smells like a backpacker's”
Reviews.Author: PC1-6
Reviews.Content: The only thing that differentiates this from budget accommodation is the price. The airconditioning didn't work, the doors were half painted, the furniture chipped and damaged. Someone's smelly socks left under the sofa bed. Room very small and extremely noisy. All unpleasant. Having said that, the front office staff were friendly, if somewhat forgetful and although they promised to get back to us with information twice, they didn't. The restaurant serves great food but be prepared for a lengthy wait, to help yourself to the menus and ask for them to take your order and to practically beg them to take your money (the lass serving us disappeared for lengthy periods twice while we were trying to pay -- very odd).

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: caligrace
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right down the street from the train station and you can take the trolley across the street to the museum and red light districts. Also walking distance to Anne Frank house. Rooms are good size and ok. Staff is friendly and helpful. Try the numbered steaks in the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: etush
Reviews.Content: the hotel in general is fine but it isn't a 4* hotel, staff is polite and helpful our room was quite big but with a massive lack of light! only a tiny lamp for the whole room!! anyway the bathroom was pretty big too and the view was just facing the royal palaca which was nice but noisy sometimes. as i said the hotel was fine is just too expensive for what it is...

Reviews.Title: “AVOID THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: JacquiB34
Reviews.Content: The room was tiny, dull, poky. Had no drawers at all and few facilities. The staff were uncaring and the lift was broken for almost our whole stay and we were on the 4th floor. No one helped the guests drag heavy bags up flights of steep stairs. If you want to pay 4 star prices for a 2 star hotel then go ahead and waste your money! We thought we had pre paid breakfast. We had not and were charged 19 euros for 1 breakfast which was disgraceful and very poor quality and value.

Reviews.Title: “Very central, clean hotel, good breakfast, would definitely go back”
Reviews.Author: gaffer44
Reviews.Content: Tram stopped right outside and only a 10 minute walk to Central station, this was a great central location for sightseeing in Amsterdam. Hotel staff were nice and very helpful, even answering our emails in English giving us loads of information, even down to the tram numbers. The food was lovely and we feel that for the little extra we paid for this hotel, compared to others, it was all worth it for the central location, friendly staff, good food and cleanliness of the facilities. The rooms were very nice and comfortable. Our view wasn't the best but our friends had great rooms too. even free internet on the computer in the lobby, which was very handy as we had to print our boarding passes for our flights and the staff were more than happy to do so. It was a bit unfortunate that the lift was out of order and the air conditioning was also broken and the bar closed early because it was not busy, good job as it was too expensive anyway (as is the rest of Amsterdam). We would definitely recommend this hotel to all.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: dinoHampshire
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights and very dissappointed in this hotel. For the money (cÂ£250) I was expecting at least a reasonable room without holes in the sheets, little space and no double glazing. Very noisy when the street woke up in the morning. Breakfast was e19 and then you had to pay tax on top! Very scary lady in the bar at first and the reception were havng an argument with another customer when we got there. Overall a good location but way too expensive for it and the staff need some training. One positive is that they did stop me booking the airport shittle and adivsed the tram and train as better value (and it was).

Reviews.Title: “Great location but ...”
Reviews.Author: UKDavidN
Reviews.Content: .. variable rooms. I have stayed here now 3-4 times over the last three years & I'm still a little reluctant to recommend it wholeheartedly. The room I had recently was Room 203 and it was the worst yet. Positives: new bathroom; excellent shower; lovely comfortable bed. Negatives: the really tired furniture consisting of a narrow wardrobe, a bedside table and a long writing desk for which there wasn't enough room (it was placed at an angle partly against the window and one wall such that it left a gap of only a few inches at the bottom of the bed); there was no double glazing (this was a room overlooking the street at the back of the hotel). The air conditioning isn't working in the hotel as its being refurbished from now until mid September. I do hope that the refurbishment extends to some other aspects. Not sure how this hotel is 4* as I compare it with the Convent Hotel a few hundred yards away which is also 4*. I guess that the ill fitting writing desk could be the result of an edict which states that all rooms in a 4* have to have one. All in all, if you get a good price, then go for it but lower your 4* expectations just in case there are more rooms like mine lurking somewhere. Hotels do seem to forget that they are only as good as their weakest link and if this had been my first stay here then I would not have gone back.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: Redhillrunner
Reviews.Content: LOCATION-good, next to tram lines which take you to museums. HOTEL RESTAURANT-closed the night we stayed and we did not hang around to have breakfast the next day. BAR-excellent numbered steak. CONCIERGE STAFF- female staff helpful on arrival and assisted us to but museum tickets from them at standard that saved us lining up when we arrived. INTERNET-free in lobby area (cabled computer). ROOM- that is the problem. We stayed in room 103 and paid Aust $400 via our travel agent or about Euros 270 for a room that concierge staff said would be between 80 and 140 Euros depending on business. WE were silly and should have checked out when we saw the room. THe furniture was old and dilapidated and scratched extensively. Chair was broken. Walls were dirty and marked and looked like not cleaned. Someone else's leftover sock in the baggage rack is consistent with that view. Curtains had multiple holes from what looked like cigarette burns; some were repaired with needle and thread. Main curtains when drawn had 6 inch gap in the centre and did not meet. THe "bed" was hard, and bed head comprised of two parts; one looked like single bed and the other a double. Head lamps were positioned perfectly... to bump one's head if one tried to sit up to read. Bed hard, and no air-conditioning; sign said under repair. Room noisy from street noise all night despite window closed despite the heat and no air-con, and the street lights and curtain gap meant that when we work up hourly we thought it was day time. We were in room 103 at back of hotel away from trams on other side. We left 6am next day and did not bother to have breakfast. I have given same comments to staff of hotel and have additional photos to back up my statement that I will provide to the hotel wholesaler back here. I find it hard to believe that a single hotel will have some disgusting rooms and some wonderful ones, and thus can only speculate about the reasons behind the variability of reviews of this hotel on TRipAdvisor, which I actually reviewed before staying there. A hotel that cannot provide a clean room with functioning air conditioning and curtains that close is not worthy of any stars.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible!”
Reviews.Author: Nadine1969
Reviews.Content: smallest hotel room i have ever stayed in and its a double. All i can say is thank god i am not with my partner as you can not swing a cat in it!!! without prior warning, the hotel has decided to upgrade their airconditioning system at the end of June so i am currently sat in my room in a pool of sweat after just having a shower!!!! I asked them for a fan and was told they had none left - its a disgrace. the hotel needs some serious updating and as for the reception staff - all i can advise is be prepared to stand there for a very long time before you are even acknowledged!!!! I have stayed in cheaper hotels in Amsterdam and they have been a million times better!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent enough hotel, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: rebeccaj5622
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from a Friday to Monday. After I had booked and paid for the trip through an agency, I was informed by the agency that the hotel was undergoing renovations and they would only be working during the day on the weekend and I should let them know if that would be problematic. It wasn't really, but while we were lounging around in our room on Saturday, a maintenance person came to fix the mirror over the desk, so we told him the bathroom fan didn't work and a light was out and the safe didn't work. He took care of the issues but it was somewhat of an intrusion on our privacy as we wanted to nap. The heat in the room didn't seem to work either, although I didn't know it at the time the maintenance guy was there. There was also some really loud music in another room for about 30 min but that occurred before 11 Saturday night so we didn't complain. This hotel was clean and the staff were nice. The location was fantastic - we walked to Anne Frank House, shopping, red light district, lots of restaurants, trams were nearby, etc. A super yummy pastry shop was just a couple doors down from the hotel and we enjoyed that every day! The room was a little small but I have very limited experience with European hotels and think that might just be the norm. The price seemed reasonable. Overall, a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Poorer than average”
Reviews.Author: Ted023
Reviews.Content: Not up to four star standard. We had a "superior room" which lacked sufficient drawer space for your clothes. Lifts were slow: air conditioning did not work (it was a warm weekend) and breakfasts were no better5 than average.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Charm”
Reviews.Author: shoeguyUSA
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect location. The hotel itself has a lot of charm and a real dutch experience. Rooms are just fine. Grab an executive or superior room if you wish. The bar is classic Dutch and a great place to have a cold Heineken. Instead of the complaints from people, try and just enjoy your visit/vacation. Take in the charm. Much of Amstedam's pleasure arises from just being in this vibrant city.

Reviews.Title: “Itchy”
Reviews.Author: Roger580419
Reviews.Content: We spent the nights itching and the noise from the trams and street did not stop until mid-night and started early the next morning. Chipped mugs and dirtly glasses. Thin towels and no toiletries.

Reviews.Title: “Not as we expected”
Reviews.Author: BARBARAHartlepool
Reviews.Content: this hotel is more like a 3 star. We booked a superior room, but there was no mini bar or fridge as mentioned in the write up. The room we were given was at the front of the hotel, which we thought great, until we tried to sleep, when we discovered the trams ran from about 6:00 am until about 1:00am. After the first night of no sleep we asked to be moved to a quiet room, which we were very promptly, I assume there were rooms available because a few guests had checked out that morning. The next room was not a superior room. The double bed was two single beds pushed together and made up as singles. The bath was stained, and if you are a gentleman who uses an electric shaver you will not find a shaver point in the bathroom, just as well my husband is a wet shaver. Also the hairdryer is situated in the bathroom, which would not be allowed in the UK for safety reasons. One good point is the bar which is excellant. The barman even remembered all four of our drinks after the first night., The other point is the hotel is very central. If you there in April the Tulip gardens at Keukenhof really are a must.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty on the outside!”
Reviews.Author: worldalmanac
Reviews.Content: This hotel leaves a lot to be desired. upon arrival, we were impressed with the facade and the lobby. that was where the charm ended. the room was dismal. it smelled of smoke and sported one two chairs and a narrow desk, that was it. no place to put clothes or suitcase. I based my decision to stay here on the ratings from this site, my recommendation, don't stay here, stay at the Convent Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Not up to our standards”
Reviews.Author: WAYZATA55
Reviews.Content: The rooms at this hotel are small, tired, Scandanavian sparse. The beds are hard and uncomfortable, and one can feel the springs through the mattress. Like most cheap hotels, it has "pancake" pillows: flat, tired, hard pieces of foam rubber rather than feathers or fiber fill. There is less than two feet between the bed and the desk, leaving inadequate room to work. The lamps use low wattage flourescent bulbs, and are physically attached to the end tables and the desk so that it is impossible to generate adequate light to read. The bathroom shower misfunctions most of the time, and when working fluctuates wildly from hot to cold like most cheap hotels with inadequate hot water. No toiletries are provided, and soap is instead from wall dispensers. The ceiling in the room is low, and is concrete, making clear that there is no means of expanding the room size. In the bathroom, the ceiling was covered by mildew. Our room had two small windows overlooking a court yard with, as indicated by a prior reviewer, a view of a wall 15 feet away. In the United States, this room would have been illegal because there is no fire escape--exiting the windows would result in a four story drop onto ventilation equipment surrounded by four, six story walls and no door. The common areas in the lobby and the restaurant area are more up to date. The staff is not bad, but there is no bell service, and the cashiers incompetently function as unknowing concierages. I have stayed at beautiful hotels near Schipol, and it baffles me how this hotel could be rated fourth among Amsterdam hotels. I am increasingly convinced that TripAdviser caters generally to persons with lower standards.

Reviews.Title: “I need another stay for my b-day this year.”
Reviews.Author: AMSTERDAMGRETCHEN
Reviews.Content: I realized today, 5 months since my trip to Amsterdam for my birthday in November 2010 I have to go back for my birthday in November of 2011. I will definately be staying at Die Port Van Cleve. During my last stay they were like family which made me feel extra special since I was traveling by myself from Kansas City, Mo to Amsterdam. The staff, bar and food are wonderful there. I loved my soaking tub and even when I spilled wine on one of the nice chairs in the room they treated me like family. My next stay will be in a smoking room because I want to enjoy the room this time like a true Amsterdam Citizen. I can't wait.... Love the service and all the wonderful people that work there. Can't say enough about it.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing accommodation.”
Reviews.Author: poppy12309
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed for three nights in a twin room. Seldom have I encountered such drab decor and it also had a shabby appearance. The rooom was clean, but the pillows were the cheap lumpy type and the duvet was just a thin wadded quilt. Our room looked out on to a wall about 15 ft. away. The lighting was totally inadequate and there was no dressing table mirror; there were also no drawers and the bed lights were postioned immediately under where your head would be if you sat up reading. No fridge in the room either. The bathroom was very basic and had three chips in the basin and the cheap plastic bath was cracked at the rim. If it had been really cheap I could have understood, but it wasn't. I would have complained but it took three phone calls to get an extra pillow and given the nature of the Dutch, I thought it circumspect to keep quiet. Having said that I enjoyed Amsterdam but next time I will be going 5 star not 4.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: youngmid
Reviews.Content: First thing that strikes you is the beautiful building I have stayed all over Amsterdam but this is by far the best place we have stayed.As we were coming to Amsterdam to smoke as much good marijuana and hash as possible we struck gold by getting a smoking room in the hotel which is very rare in Amsterdam nowadays.Homegrown Fantasy is right across the street and Grey Area is a stoned stumble away as well, Dam square is a minute away to. I read some dodgy reviews about the smoking rooms in this place but i was very happy with mine with a great street view to stare out at and take in the madness.I cant praise this place enough and will be staying here every time from now on. Did i mention they have smoking rooms.... the package we got online was an amazing price as well for such a great located hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, history, bar, restaurant- shame about the room!”
Reviews.Author: jampat69
Reviews.Content: Was a bit apprehensive as reviews are mixed but would stay again for a weekend break. It is the site of the original Heineken brewery and the building is lovely. Has a cool, charming bar downstairs and the steaks in the restaurant were excellent. Great location too, handy for everything. If only they spent some money refurbishing the rooms it would be fantastic for a weekend break- tired, characterless decor, two single beds pushed together for a double bed but made up as single beds - toilets were fine though and had TV, safe, kettle etc. There were 14 of us staying here for a (civilised) joint stag/hen weekend- perfect for putting your head down and meeting in bar etc but probably not for families or people wanting a classy room.

Reviews.Title: “Past it's heyday, but pretty clean and spacious. Good service.”
Reviews.Author: Traveler0987654321
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the superior suites facing De Oude Kerk. The window is directly above the entrance, first from the left in the photo. While this particular room was very spacious, I also saw one of the regular rooms, and it was tiny: this is definitely something to keep in mind when making your reservation. Our room was clean except for the two chairs with impressive stains. The rest of the furniture was clean and well kept. There were also a couple of cigarette burns on the side of the bath tub. Bathroom is nothing special, but adequate. We definitely didn't like the wall-mounted hand soap dispensers. Sheets and towels were spotless. Staff performance was immaculate for the most part. For some reason the room service didn't replace the shampoo bottles once we ran out, so I had to ask for more at the front desk. Other than that, no problems whatsoever. Overall I'd say this hotel may be past it's heyday, but our room was pretty clean and spacious, and the service was good. We wouldn't mind coming back.

Reviews.Title: “character hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: ripejack
Reviews.Content: Die Port van Cleve Amsterdam has plenty of character and is very well located, a few minutes from Centraal station and close to Dam Square. The hotel bedrooms are roomy and perfectly acceptable as a base for a lads trip, and the breakfast was unremarkable. Being the original home of the Heineken brewery, the bar is commensurately very pleasant indeed. With a better option across the street (the Sofitel Convent Hotel) and the American Hotel off Liedesplein, I wouldn't select Die Port van Cleve for a business or a romantic trip.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Pinklix
Reviews.Content: Visited this hotel as a birthday trip for my husband. Booked it through Thomas Cook and because it was so reasonable I decided to pay for an upgrade. Well on arrival at the hotel we were dealt with by a very efficient male receptionist and given directions to our room, he even helped us book a trip on the canals it was night trip which served cheese and wine, trip was not that cheap and we only got 3-4 cheeses and a couple of glasses of wine - so beware. Now getting to our room, although it was clean we had to climb down what I would call stairs that were very very steep and very narrow which left us glad that our cases were not any bigger., also if there was to be fire we would not have stood a chance . I would comment that the room was quiet but not by any stretch of my imagination would I have called the room an upgrade!! Beer was at least 1 Euro than pubs outside so it was worth going a walk. There is also a cracking little supermarket just to the left which we did not discover until quite late in out break. Breakfast was dear but is worth shopping around, also there are loads of eateries scattered about most of them very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “weekend away”
Reviews.Author: ivan1962
Reviews.Content: nice hotel a little bit tired. really central location. Breakfast is expensive 12 50. f

Reviews.Title: “Nice building, great restaurant, rooms... hummmm....”
Reviews.Author: TravellerTwo_10
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 3 nights and I did enjoy the Hotel. It is very well located, just by Dam Square and side-by-side with a shopping center. The building is very nice, well preserved and the staff was very polite and friendly. Breakfast was as hoped, I mean, it is standard but good. The rooms are not that good, because they are a little bit old, very small and not very well maintained. It was good soundproofing and kind of comfortable, but are, clearly, the weak spot of the Hotel. Nevertheless, I donâ€™t mind going back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location-Great bartender-Faisal”
Reviews.Author: landsick
Reviews.Content: We arrived from the states and were greeted very kindly by the hotel staff. Having read all the reviews, we were not expecting much, but chose the location by well, locatiion, and price. And for that, this place is worth it. On the other hand, there were cigarette butt stains all over the tub which made me feel as though I was in a crack house, only without any crack! (: A bit of street noise but that was to be expected. Some of our mates stayed in the Hotels near by and they were infinitely worse than the Van Cleve because at least the Van Cleve is fairly clean and has very large rooms,. Because of the great bartender Faisal, the heineken bar becane the focal point and meeting place of 20 plus people in our party staying nearby. However, when we went to the bar when Faisal wasn't there opn Tuesday, March 14 we had to wait and beg for service from a cold and tall blond woman who ignored us and was rude for literally 45 minutes before we could get a beer. Having said all that, the bar is beautiful,DO NOT MISS IT, make siure Faisal is your bartender, ask for the room without the nasty cigarette stains all over the bathroom (401 was ours) and you will have a wonderful stay at the Die port van cleve. Otherwise, it's a mixed bag!

Reviews.Title: “Good location.”
Reviews.Author: truckassessor
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights from 17th Feb. I can only say that this hotel is average. I'm trying to think of something good to write, but I can only come up with it's in a good, central location, not too far from the railway station.

Reviews.Title: “4 Star Hotel - I don,t think so!!!”
Reviews.Author: DaveMarr
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel belore.... I calculated it was around ten years ago. It was not great then and has had no money spent on it in that time. Was early for check in (2pm) and asked if the room was ready early could i get in to freshen up?.... I was told that no matter what time the room was ready i could not get the key before 2pm. The receptionist never cracked a smile and never bothered to greet us in any way. The stair carpets were thread bare and worn. The room was tiny and the furniture was a disgrace. I was worn and chiped and covered in burns. The bathroom was what i would expect from a 1 or 2 star hotel. The grouting was dirty round the bath and the shower has no regulation... It went from freezing to burning hot without touching the taps!!!. Very dangerous if you are elderley or have children!!@?!!!.... The toiletries were a joke for a 4 star hotel. One cheap body wash and a shower cap. The check out was handled well and at last by friendly staff..... We only had two nights there and have to say i would not want to stay any longer. I found it to be expensive and never would i have rated it as a four stat hotel...... Some one should re-invest some of the profits in this dowdy hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel - Centrally Located”
Reviews.Author: Andrew F
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Die Port Van Cleve for one night recently. Rates were very good in comparison to other hotels in the City Centre. Hotel was undergoing some refurbishment whilst we were staying but no negative signs of this. Halls had new carpets and only impact on the room was no Air Con - but not really needed at this time of year. Refurb should be completed at end of March. Staff were very friendly at check-in and stored our bags when we arrived early. They explained about the refurb and gave us vouchers for free drinks and 25% off at the bar, even though this work didn't affect us at all. Rooms were very nice inside with flatscreen TVs and free WiFi which was a nice added extra. Staff were more than helpful on checkout and stored our bags for the afternoon until needed. Would recommend this hotel to others and will stay here again when returning to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cocomac89
Reviews.Content: We visited the Die Port Van Cleve over Valentine's weekend. The staff were friendly and helpful, room was clean and the location was perfect for discovering Amsterdam as it is approx. 2 minutes walk from Dam Square. We ate in the hotel twice, once for dinner which was lovely and once in the bar (we had the Dutch platter and it was very tasty). Even though there was renovations going on during the office hours of our stay, we heard nothing. Lovely hotel and when we go back to Amsterdam (which is a definite!) we will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for exploring city centre on foot”
Reviews.Author: ctimes2
Reviews.Content: Didn't know what to expect given mixed reviews. Hotel is in process of being refurbished floor by floor however we were not affected by related noise - work is due to be completed early 2011. Room very recently recarpeted and painted so all very clean. Did not spend much time in hotel as used it as a base to explore city. Staff helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “wow.wow.wow!!!”
Reviews.Author: foxylola
Reviews.Content: we arrieved at 9 am and was asked to come back after 1pm, we left our luggage and went and hit the coffee bars.... eventually we checked in at 3pm!!! .....we got upgraded for some reason, room 501...wow it was beautifull, so very big, very clean, comfy beds, lovely bathroom, what else could we ask for... perfect,,, we did ask for a iron but was gived a key to the laundry room to use the iron, could not fault the room or the hotel its self, for breakfast ....wow..... there was such a variety to choose from, from yogurt,fruit, ceral, fish, crossiants,,, goes on and on,,, for valentines we ate in the resturant, was given a 25% voucher to use, very pleased,,,,,please try not to read all the bad views on this hotel as its just so lovely,, very clean and very friendly staff, as for amsterdam ....we called our selves the lost couple,,,, we had the best weekend away,,, if your into the coffee shops etc,, you must go to the green place and also another coffee shop which is soon as you come out of hotel turn left and its about 50yrds its chinese coffee shop....have to try the i-so-later...its strong!!!! .....enjoy ....

Reviews.Title: “Great location, awful room”
Reviews.Author: golferdeluxe
Reviews.Content: I chose the Van Cleve because it is located just one street away from Dam Plaza where you can find restaurants, coffee shops and shopping plus have easy access to all tram routes. The Van Cleve is very well located. The service at the hotel is excellent, very friendly desk clerks and also at the bar and restaurant. Rooms: that's where it goes downhill! There is no heating in the bathrooms. Ever try and open the fridge door to take a shower? Well that's exactly what you feel like. The room is small (normal I guess) and the beds are cheap. Cleanliness: the hallways have not been vacuumed in at least a month! I would not stay here again if I return to Amsterdam. I would pay a little extra and have a room I can live in!

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: Minttu-83
Reviews.Content: We were a little bit disappointed, we expected the better hotel. Our room was ok, but slightly dirty. The breakfast was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: DawnIain
Reviews.Content: The central location of this hotel was excellent with all attractions within walking distance. If you do not like to walk there is tram stops outside the entrance. The welcolm from the reception was warm and the room we had 608 was huge! Singles only but was set together. The shower was hot and powerful and there was also a bath. We had a sitting area and flat screen telly that had BBC. The breakfast was included and very good with some excellent staff. I was taken there by my husband to celebrate my 50th birthday and as my husband told the hotel in advance we were presented with a free drink voucher and 25% discount for dinner (which was very good). Best attraction was candle lit cruise with unlimited wine and cheeses, the Heinieken and Anne Frank. Worsed and hopeless one was the Ice Bar. Well worth a visit!!

Reviews.Title: “Alright, good location”
Reviews.Author: emmalouisemonaghan
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fine, a bit shabby but we just needed somewhere to put our heads for a few days and it was okay. Had an excellent time in Amsterdam. Rene - we will see you soon.

Reviews.Title: “great location !”
Reviews.Author: lynsey3
Reviews.Content: Loved staying here . Amazing location , nice sized room 4212 . Sadly no view from our room as we were in the eves but, the room had character and was very well layed out (split level) . It could do with a referb quite dated 1980's . but very clean . At check in we were given a map which the man circled the hotel for us and any where else we asked . Very nice and friendly and went out of his way to help us . From reading the other reviews we were prepared for the 100e deposite which seems very steep especially when no mention of this fee when we booked . We didn't eat at the restaurant so can't comment but the place looked very beautiful . Not alot of time spent in the room but who goes to amsterdam to stay in? Very nice hotel we will be going back

Reviews.Title: “Very Good 3 Star "Red Roof-ish" Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Buquing
Reviews.Content: People here are right...I wouldn't call it a 4 star for European Standards...but the location is why you'd want to stay here...room was spacious (bigger than I expected) and I found the bathroom clean...web rate under â‚¬90 so think I got a good deal...avoid breakfast!! it's a rip-off and it wasn't that good either..staff were distant (only had one girl at front desk who seemed to enjoy her job)..probably will stay here again..

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: maggietravelista89
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location that truly makes up for any other flaw, yet I wouldn't consider this a 4 star hotel. It had many charming elements, and a spacious room, but the bathroom needed an update. Ancient hair dryer, and the bath tub seemed less than chic. Also, the front desk was not truly helpful to first-time Amsterdam visitors. I was hoping for more guided advice on places to eat, tours to take, ect.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel that has has great location but let down by its rooms and few staff"”
Reviews.Author: ady_mills
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Amsterdam and was a treat for my girlfriend so chose a 4* hotel as a special birthday surprise. As there was snow on the ground and was slightly worried about delayed flights and getting stuck for a couple of days in another country without a hotel room and ATOL protection I decided to book through a travel agent and pay in the region of Â£850 for 3 nights B&B and flights. On arrival at the hotel we where really impressed with the check in, however I was slightly bemused when my credit card was charged Â£83 to cover any damages that may occur during our stay?? (Now in the hands of credit card dispute department as money taken without authority). On arrival to our our room (607) I was really dismayed to see a small room with a double bed pushed against the the wall and every bit of floor space taken up with either chairs, or a table.etc (I could not sit on the floor by the side of the bed and put my shoes on due to lack of space. The room looked like a single with a double bed put in it.). To top matters off the room must have been a smoking room at one stage as the ceiling and walls where tinged with yellow. The bathroom was not much better. As it was -7 outside I would have liked some heat, however with the radiator half hanging off we could not get it to turn on. There was a maintainence tag to put on the door which we put out on the first morning for housekeeping, however that was simply placed back in our room every day and no action taken to fix the problems. On the second day my girlfriend came back to our room as she forgot her camera. When she got back our room door was wide open where housekeeping had been in, then left it wide open for ANYONE else to come in as they please after they had finished. Then only good thing about the hotel is the honesty and politness of the bar staff and the way in which they are meant to serve meals, run the bar, keep bar tabs and keep the bar clean as well as serving coffee in reception at the same time. I think the way in which the star system is awarded, is awarded differently in Amsterdam compared to the UK and that possibly the "Die Port van Cleve Hotel" may be a three star rather than a four star.

Reviews.Title: “smelly”
Reviews.Author: fraher
Reviews.Content: our superior double was two singles pushed together,not enough bedding as it was very cold, the first thing was an awful smell which was in the room all the time,smelled like sewerage,not nice,curtains hanging of hooks on one side,shower curtain hanging of the hooks.we could not sit on the toilet properly as there was enough room in front for our legs,had to sit sideways on the tolilet.location was great,staff really nice,such a shame as this is a great hotel with lots of potential.

Reviews.Title: “100 euro deposit demanded”
Reviews.Author: Paul1008
Reviews.Content: My daughter and her boyfriend stayed at this hotel for 2 nights and on arrival there were asked to leave a deposit of 100 euros. This was a large percentage of their spending money and upset them greatly. I contacted lastminute as to why this wasn't advised on their website and to their credit they firstly contacted the hotel and got the deposit reduced to 50 euros and secondly said it would be reported and followed up. I contacted the hotel directly and was told that EVERY hotel in the world takes a deposit , Well no Marcus they don't - so much for helpful staff.!!!! On top of all this the hotel was poor and the room very small.

Reviews.Title: “The only good thing about this place is its location - avoid at all costs!”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Skunk
Reviews.Content: Booked into the Die Poort Van Cleve despite reading mixed reviews as its location was excellent and it seemed extremely good value for a 4* hotel. On arrival we were told that there was no room for us "because the fire alarms were not working" but we could stay in a nearby hotel just 15 minutes away. I asked them to show me this alternative hotel on the map - they could not because they only had city centre maps and this was 15ks out of town near the airport. We had specifically booked a central hotel as running the marathon the next morning and public transport was disrupted - told them this was not good enough and to find us somewhere central. On returning to the hotel an hour later they had miraculously found us a room, although it was "smoking". Reluctantly accepted due to lack of alternatives. Room (on top floor - to be avoided) was DISGUSTING - the smell was almost unbearable, it was tiny with minute windows which barely let in any light and the decor was dated and dirty looking. Went out for the evening having left the door open to air. On return to hotel the staff had again miraculously found a smoker who wanted to swap their relatively nice "upgraded" room with our foul stinking pit - although this was quite clearly a lie as the room we got had a balcony so they could easily have nipped out for a fag. The room we eventually had was okay - big for Amsterdam but with rather knackered beds and again, the decor was extremely tired-looking and the room smelled musty, like it was recently converted from smoking to non-smoking. At the front of the hotel so also very noisy at night. Staff throughout this whole fiasco were rude, smirking and made no attempt to compensate us for the hassle and wasted time. Do not stay here

Reviews.Title: “absoute satisfaction.”
Reviews.Author: fainaj
Reviews.Content: you can't find a more centrally located hotel for such an amazingly reasonable prize! staff is very friendly and helpful. they practice a very personal approach, always find a nice word and a joke, and guiding tips.

Reviews.Title: “not 4* but a very good 3* good location helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: samφll
Reviews.Content: on reading reviews after we had booked we were a bit dubious on arrival.. the hotel lobby and reception are really plush but the rooms could do with a facelift, our room 124 was quite spacious but most are not, very clean, very friendly and helpful staff..good location 1 min walk from dam square..

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Marnie09
Reviews.Content: Perfectly located hotel for walking every direction in lovely Amsterdam. Staff was friendly and helpful. Breakfast was a buffet in a large DR with windows fronting on the street with more than enough selections to fill us for a day of sightseeing. Room was adequate in size, comfortable and clean. Could use more wattage for reading at night but that would be our only complaint! We will definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but a good 3* not 4*...”
Reviews.Author: Cloggy8
Reviews.Content: This is the second time i have stayed in this hotel, last time was 7 years ago. First time was with my girlfriend, this time was with a friend who was running the marathon. The location is ideal as it is right on Dam square and only a 5 minute walk from central station. One arrival i had forgotten how nice the hotel looks from outside. Especially at night when its all lit up. At the reception i cant say we was welcomed, the staff could be a lot more friendly. Check in didn't take too long and we was pointed to the lift. The Room Our room was a decent size, Two very comfy good sized single beds, TV, coffee/Tea facilities, safe. The bathroom was very clean and a nice size too. The only problem i had with the room was it was freezing, the maids always left the window open, and during the night the radiator didn't work.
