Didn't book breakfast as the hotel wanted â‚¬19 pp per day. The bar is quite nice, but very quiet with no life. If you didn't know this, the hotel is the old heineken brewery. Depending on what you are going to Amsterdam for, this hotel is a only minutes walk from the Red light district, Bars & coffeeshops. There is a tram(1) stop right outside the hotel which will take you to Leidseplein and beyond and the other side of the royal palace is another tram(4, 16) stop that will take you to Rembrandt square. There is a shopping centre next to the hotel and a supermarket 400 yards past that. Vondel Park is very nice and worth a walk round, Don't forget the giant IAmsterdam letters. Also if you fancy somewhere cheap to eat, find a palace called Burger Meester, delicious freshly made burgers. All in all I would use this Hotel agin if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “I think you can get better for the money”
Reviews.Author: Graysautos
Reviews.Content: Arrived about 16:00. Happy staff at reception, cracking jokes and really happy to help you. Got to room 131 which was in the middle of the hotel. The room was a bit dark but nice and clean. The bed was two singles put together, but fine, one thing I would say was there was only two pillows, not much but, what can I say, I like my pillows. Went over to the window, opened the curtains, and saw the massive boiler or ventilation system which was making a right racket. beyond the boiler was other rooms so, no view either. the only reason we didn't ask for a room change, is that, we were only there for two days so we thought it wasn't worth it. This hotel isn't a Four star, its a Three. The only reason the Van Cleve gets a 4 is that its in a great location and it has a lift.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Alaska_Lola
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on Expedia and it was a fantastic deal! The hotel was very easy to find and a short walk from the train station. We arrived very early in the morning and the hotel staff kept our luggage as we wandered around. Down the street is Albert Heijn and there you will find food and wine to take back to your room if you want. We loved going there for beer and wine for our nights before bed. The staff was very friendly and the breakfast was wonderful. We liked the hotel so much we booked another 2 nights upon our arrival back to Amsterdam. Hotel is a short walk from the Red Light District and flower market. Our room was small but that is to be expected in Europe. It was very cute and we loved the beds - clean and comfy.

Reviews.Title: “Not a four star hotel”
Reviews.Author: jaygeemack
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ranked as four star - but this is very deceptive. Our room was very small and the beds had seen better days. The location was good - central Amsterdam, but that is about all taht can be said about it.

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything, friendly/helpful staff, all the amenities”
Reviews.Author: bassgrrl
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. It was close to everything, and very comfortable. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly, and all amenities are covered here. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Unclean, cramped and dingy”
Reviews.Author: Jones_ro
Reviews.Content: The rooms were dirty, cramped and shabby. Too much furniture crammed into a small room (had to squeeze sideways to get from the door past the bed). Carpets were filthy in the rooms and the hallways. Mold in the shower tiles. Bedding worn, thin and threadbare. Cigarette burns on the bathroom fixtures in a non-smoking room. Duvets on the bed were dense and clammy, not fluffy. The staff was OK but not particularly helpful. The bar downstairs was closed one day for no reason. The much-vaunted restaurant was only open for breakfast and lunch and grossly overpriced--and virtually empty at mealtime, not encouraging us to eat there. Promised wi-fi was not available except in the hotel lobby. All in all, a real disappointment in a city that has literally hundreds of small hotels. Not recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but not value for money”
Reviews.Author: IanlLondon
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel before and was not impressed last time, I had to ask for a room change last time. I booked again as I know it's location well. I knew it was going to be expensive but with the IBC inter nation broadcasters convention on they hike the prices up. By 100 euros a night and add nothing extra. Breakfast is still 19 euros. But with cages and McDonalds a minute walk away not a real issue. Got to say their wifi is useless it only works in the lobby. Not even in the bar!!! free wifi and Internet though. Internet in e room is cable only or via the tv. No use for iPhone or iPad or other smart phone. The rooms are small but to be fair you can go for a walk and watch the sites. Very close to the central staion, tram stop right outside hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Vinegarhill
Reviews.Content: Second time we have stayed here,i last reviewed back in 2007 and wasnt very complimentary on the standard of the room so went back with a little trepidation. The reason i booked it again was i knew it was a very central location and we dont go on holiday to go over a hotel room with a fine toothcomb ! We also like the bar onto the front street. The room was small but much better than the last time we stayed. We had no complaints whatsoever. The front desk staff were very friendly and obliging. Overall decent enough hotelat a decent enough price. Ive stayed many times in Amsterdam and there are better hotels but youll pay a much higher price.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but no frills hotel”
Reviews.Author: SPclaire
Reviews.Content: Great location in the centre of town, easy walking distance to everything. Staff on reception friendly. But the rooms were tiny & very basic, and the bathroom was pretty grotty. At night the room was boiling hot, there was no air-con or ceiling fan and windows could only open a crack.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star hotel - probably 2!!! Overpriced, dirty and tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: MaverickMat
Reviews.Content: stayed there for 3 nights on the last leg of my journey after covering Paris and Brussels. Had booked 4 stars hotels in all the cities, but this hotel in Amsterdam turned out to be a nightmare. - the first night we had to stay in a dingy double bed room, with no-ac, anda pedestal fan which made so much noise that we could hardly sleep - The next day we got our room changed, and on entering it found that only one lamp out of three worked. The room was slightly bigger though than the previous one - as we entered the bathrrom, we were greeted by a big blob of hair sticking on the bathroom wall grinning at us. AAARG! We requested the reception to clean it and left for dinner - upon return, the blob of hair was still there, and the bathroom had a very unplesant smell as well. We called the reception and requested to get it cleaned. The lady at the reception curtly told us that it had been cleaned. We invited her to our room to have a look for herself - when she herself saw the filthiness, she apologised. The next day the manager apologised as well, but our trip had been ruined. - We spent a fortune on staying at this hotel, but it was a total waste of money. The hotel is in a very good location, quite central, but it needs a refurbishment, and seriously needs to up its standards to qualify as a 4 star hotel -

Reviews.Title: “time for a refurnishment”
Reviews.Author: JPPAAL
Reviews.Content: we had a 3 persons room so big enough. the furniture was full of dirty spots everywhere. the personal on the receptiondesk tried really hard to help, but there competences were really poor. Drinks in the fridge had passed their sustainability date. max. 3***

Reviews.Title: “Oh Dear - put this lady out of her misery”
Reviews.Author: NLBatEBR
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location and sits behind a lovely listed facade. And that's all it has going for it. The room set's new standards. At first my hopes were high as we were told we had been upgraded to a suite. So off we went (help with baggage? - no - you can sort that yourself. Show you to your room? No - I'm sure you'll find it). First impression - its a huge room. But what's the smell. Smells like drains. Oh it is drains. It used to be two rooms and when they removed the bathroom they left open drains. You could hear and smell them. And a bed head and some very weird lighting. Actual bedroom had two cupboards but limited storage. Bathroom (there's that smell again) was big but shower had no temperature control. Ran very hot to cold and back again. Main room has huge bay window with great view of Dam Square (almost). Paint and carpet are a mess. Breakfast menu was dutifully laid out every day (we didn't use it). It had handwritten complaints on it from guests of two months before. Complaints that hadn't been fixed. e.g. blown light bulbs were still blown. This poor old lady needs to be closed, gutted and rebuilt behind that lovely facade. Which needs cleaning. She could be beautiful. Until then stop pretending it's fit for use.

Reviews.Title: “In Danish standards this would be a nice 3 star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: AnoukW
Reviews.Content: After booking this hotel I unfortunatly read some of the reviews in here, and I was concerned what it was going to be like. But it was a very POSITIVE experience. We had booked a room with two single beds, and we got one where the beds where pushed together, but that was the only thing not being as promised. We were given new towels everyday and the bedsheets were changed and the room cleaned up. We had a window turning away from the street and it was very quit. We visited the hotel when it was 30 degrees Celcius outside, so naturally it was warm, even in the nights and no there wasnt aircondition, but the hotel never promised that there would be! It doesnt say that on their website. The windows had mosquito nets, so we could easily keep the windows open at night without being bothered by anything. The staff was helpfull with directions to almost anything we asked, and our luggage was stored for 6 hours after check-out with no problems at all. I also read that some had said the rooms smelled funny - Ours didnt at all :) All in all it was a positive experience, and we are most certainly returning at our next visit to Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “awfull”
Reviews.Author: sweetfan
Reviews.Content: i booked and payed in advance for a double room, when i got to the room it was a tiny single one, so i went back to reception and they gave me a key for another room, when i got to this room there was a couple in bed (whoops), so another trip to reception. the THIRD room was fine to start with , until i tried to use the phone and all the electrics went POP (no tv no nothing)the fourth room was ok , not great but ok. later that night i thought i would order a meal on room service , four phone calls later , still no answer, so i phoned reception to complain and all they did was put me through to room service and yes you've guessed it NO ANSWER the hotel was in a great location , but i'll never stay again, i normally stay at NH hotels they are much better

Reviews.Title: “Great location and decent no-frills hotel”
Reviews.Author: tonymunch
Reviews.Content: must admit, after reading a lot of the reviews on this site after i booked this hotel up, i was really worried about what i was going to get. tiny rooms, very shabby, dirty, windows that didn't open, showers that didn't work etc etc.. I don't usually write reviews about hotels, and certainly wouldn't bother complaining. but i was very surprised when i turned up here last week, and its a great place to stay. i would say that its 4* is probably a bit optimistic, but its nowhere near a bad as people are saying (its a decent 3* no problem). the reception staff were great. the hotel room, bedding and towels are all clean, as was the bathroom which was spotless. the beds are comfortable. and the windows definately open! theres been a lot said about the size of the rooms, and maybe they are a little on the small side. but if you are just sleeping and getting ready here, the rooms are fine. i've been really happy with this hotel and would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: 5starAussies
Reviews.Content: Recommended to us a four star quality. To access our 'executive room' had to go down concrete steps in small hall. Room was filthy, couch torn and worn and no air-conditioning just a tiny fan. Two single beds for a double. Disgusting and poor value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe not a 4*”
Reviews.Author: avalon72
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as I thought the pictures looked good and had mostly good reviews, as you walk into the lobby it does look 4* and the receptionist was very polite. Stored our bags until we could check in, then when we did check in and got to the room, well I'm afraid it wasn't quite the 4* as hoped, it had a safe and tea and coffee facilities as promised, the bed was comfortable so no problems there, the hair dryer was a hot air hand dryer at best and with long hair, i'm glad i took my own. There was no draw space so had to live out of the case, hubbies being on a luggage rack and mine on the floor, only one mirror which was full length and to be any use we took down from the wall and placed in a more suitable area, ie against the room entrance door. The tv worked and the bathroom was clean although the shower although being hot had seen better days and was more a jet as opposed to a shower. The website stated the bar was open until 0100 but wasnt and closed at 2300 or at 2250 as we discovered. All in all not bad but not 4* and probably wouldnt stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: Rub3s
Reviews.Content: I think this hotel was just right for what you need in Amsterdam - brilliant location (just off of Dam Square), the rooms were the right size and clean, the shower worked and was pretty good too and the beds are comfy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Small Room, Kind of Smelled, Pretty Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Nati_Traveler1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 2 nights in the first week of May. We absolutely loved the location of it which is why we selected it. We read all of the reviews and took our chances. The reviews seemed to be pretty spot on for us. Great location, smaller room, kind of smelled like a party. Lobby was great as everyone writes, definitely misleading. But, for the price and the location and the minimal amount of time you are actually in the hotel, a strong smelling candle that we bought got us pretty comfortable. The recommendation comes with a disclaimer in that if you are hoping to stay in a hotel that is on a budget, we would recommend. If not, Im sure you could find something better and with an equally good location. For the price, we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Will not book again”
Reviews.Author: JulieJooles25
Reviews.Content: Great Location right on dam sqaure turned up 30 mins early for check in they said room not ready please come back which we did when we arrived back they took ages to check us in and even had the cheek to say this is lovely room we have given you. Well got to the room 2nd floor funny smell opened the door and my jaw dropped this was our anniveryday and we going to spend it in a crappy run down superior room NOT shouldnt have been given 1 star. Twin beds we asked for a double oh well tv but nearly every channel needed paying for at 12.50 euros a day our view was an air conditoning unit all we needed to do was look up and we then saw the sky. We complained and asked to move to a better room they said we are fully booked please ask tomorrow morning which we did and they still said fully booked. All i can say is i would never go again on the up side the twin beds were really comfortable. Bathroom ok and there was a safe in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Location,Location,Location”
Reviews.Author: sally 21
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel at Amsterdam airport with the tourist information centre. We paid 91 euros per night ( excl.breakfast ) We walked to the hotel from Central station and it took just 10 mins.You cant fault the location of this hotel. The hotel is a fantasic looking building. Check in was slow ( and we were the only people there) and Marina the receptionist was not the happiest girl in the world.This was mirrored by check out as this also took ages. The room was facing the front of the hotel on the 5th floor.You could hear the road noise when the window was open and you needed the window open during the day as the room was very warm.Room had coffee maker, flat screen tv,safe and a fan.Room was clean and had eveerything we needed.Bathroom was very nice, clean and the usual toiletries. We had breakfast one morning at the hotel which was very nice but then it was expensive( 20 euros per person ) All in all a good hotel in a great location just slow, unhappy reception staff.

Reviews.Title: “good location in historic building”
Reviews.Author: romanova1
Reviews.Content: Very good location - you are just accross the Dome Square. Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but.....”
Reviews.Author: jimmylonghurst
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights and got a deal for Â£150, which we thought was pretty good at the time. The location is perfect, right behind the Palace and Dam Square and near to the Jordaan. The rooms are not so perfect. Our first room (127) was at the end of a corridor and down a 'fire escape'. The room was tiny and dingy and stank of smoke. We were then moved to room 203, non-smoking but once again small. The safe did not work and the desk unit was falling apart. The bathroom was decent but could have done with an anti-slip mat in the shower. The bar 'Blaauwe Parade' is a lovely space but the bar tender didn't seem to want to acknowledge us and after what seemed like forever (5mins) we weren't served and so went elsewhere. This hotel markets itself as 4*, but really it would struggle to get 3* in any other city. The facade is beautiful but the inners certainly aren't.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: cynthial78
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were courteous and helpful, and our room was clean though small. The only problem was that other guests were extremely loud late at night. The management was happy to help quiet them down.

Reviews.Title: “Easy to find, good location”
Reviews.Author: Phewtorquay
Reviews.Content: Check-in was smooth and efficient. The staff were polite. Our room was situated on the 4th floor in the eaves of the roof. It was clean, en-suite, with twin beds, TV and room safe. It had one window which you could not see out of without climbing on a chair. There was some noise from the tram stop outside the hotel, but it was not intrusive. The room did not have air-conditioning, so it would be very hot in the summer months. The location of the hotel was excellent as it backs onto Dam Square and has a tram stop outside. The breakfast was an excellent hot & cold buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel-Good location”
Reviews.Author: Couple_asking_info
Reviews.Content: It is in a great location. 5 minutes walk to the central station. Albert Hejin supermarket, a shopping centre and post office almost adjacent. They have a pub and a nice restaurant. Food is extra. Breakfast is 14Euros if you order for all your stay, 18 if you take randomly. Historic building. Clean. Friendly front desk staff. Spacious rooms. Flat screen TV. Mattress was a little too soft but ok. I suggest again and I will go again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice clean and friendly!”
Reviews.Author: Hanniiiii
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was extremely welcoming and I was a bit dubious about going when I read past reviews but me and my boyfriend went on 15th January and enjoyed it as they were very helpful for directions and anything you needed. The hotel is about 5 mins walk from Anne Frank's house - its behnd the hotel and Dam Square about 10 mins across the road through the main shopping district. Its a very good and quiet location. Didnt experience any rats or dirt or road noise and our room was at front of hotel overlooking the road. It was a standard room which was very nice and spacious. Central Station is about 10-15 mins walk straight opposite the front of central station. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and booked to go back in July. We didnt eat here but food smelt very good and locals and businessmen would usually be in the bar and restaurant. I would add if your bringing alcohol to your room from outside dont buy in local shops - there is a large supermarket (downstairs) when you come out of hotel and turn left about 3 mins walk after traffic lights and the drink is cheaper there than anywhere else. Think its called Gall & Gull or something. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, staff, rooms and yeah, almost everything was great!”
Reviews.Author: Cucumber021
Reviews.Content: Really, donÂ´t trust the bad reviews. Me and my girlfriend stayed for four days at Die port van Cleve and we are very satisfied. The hotel staff was very welcoming and the room was great. To speculate about the bad reviews, maybe the standard of the rooms is different but our perfectly sized room with windows (which we could open) was perfect. Tea and coffey could be made at the room with a water-boiler, also in the room the whole stay. Free hi-speed internet in the rooms (by cable).Location is everything and this hotel really offers it, at maximum two minutes walk from the Dam square. The one and only thing we could complain at was the water pressure in the shower, in our opinion too week but thatÂ´s individual. Next stay in Amsterdam, cause weÂ´ll go there again, weÂ´re definitly going to Die port van Cleve!

Reviews.Title: “great service”
Reviews.Author: weekender2010
Reviews.Content: I was in Amsterdam last weekend and had a great time. Service is personal and warm especially at reception. Staff is very attentive and always have the right suggestion to make sure you know what to do while in Amsterdam and they explained a lot about the hotel when i checked in (usually in other hotels you have to ask for it) I spent already a few weekend in Amsterdam in other hotels but next time I will come back to this one. Rooms are a bit outdated but clean and fine for the rate i paid, location is just perfect and they had a special breakfast offer, however surprisingly this restaurant doesn't have a toaster, but not a big deal. I really don't understand how other people could write negative reviews about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the negative reviews”
Reviews.Author: WhistlingGypsy
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel many times, the latest in December 2009, and have received nothing but exemplary service and found the rooms well-equipped, warm, clean and comfortable - and I have never seen a mouse or had any cause for complaint. My only quibble is the price of the breakfast which has gone up to Euros 19 which makes it no longer good value for money and they have installed do-it-yourself tea and coffee machines and got rid of the waitresses. I had an excellent breakfast in a little cafe around the corner for Euros 5. That apart, I would recommend this hotel to anyone and wonder if the writers of the negative reviews actually stayed at Port van Cleve, or maybe they are professional moaners. Stay here - and judge for yourself!!!

Reviews.Title: “So-Called Superior Room - Anything But Superior!!”
Reviews.Author: bubbaluvdawgandco
Reviews.Content: The pictures might look good but the reality is a totally different story. I paid up for what I thought was going to be a "superior" room....better than the regular rooms - HA! Only one elevator was working and it was so slow we took the stairs most times (can you say inconvenient?). The hotel lobby smelled of stale smoke and our room was disappointing to say the least. Not on the first floor but not on the ground floor, we had to navigate ourselves and our luggage down and half spiral stairwell only just wide enough for my suitcase on stairs not even wide enough for my feet. It was just a half floor up from the road and it was loud and noisy all night. Add to that that I was freezing through the night since you cannot adjust the temperature in your room - I slept fully clothed and in my fleece jacket to stay warm. So much for the extra money I paid for this "superior" room. It wasn't superior, it wasn't even marginal. Don't stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with a lot of history but service a little slow”
Reviews.Author: DerbyboyTurvesUK
Reviews.Content: It was a long weekend birthday surprise for my wife. We has a party of 4 adults and booked months prior to the visit. It is in a great location and walking distance to Anne Frank House, Red light district and right on Dam square, and walking distance to the mainline station. Most of the staff are very friendly and helpfull but you always find some that cant be bothered. The rooms were basic and ours smelt of smoke from the prvious occupier. We ate in the blue bar a number of times and had a great time, the food was good but a little pricy, but then again it is in the City. The thing is location is great but the Hotel is basic, its a room for when you are not sightseeing. Will we go back - probably if the euero gets better

Reviews.Title: “We Won't Be Coming Back to this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: siestadoro
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here on 4 previous occasions, mainly because of the history of the hotel, the location, the Executive rooms, the friendly staff, and the good food in the lovely restaurant. This time the visit was a nightmare. We had booked way in advance, to the hotel direct, via their internet site - an Executive Double for my husband and I and a twin-bedded Superior Room (single occupancy) for my niece. I particlularly requested that both rooms should be on the 3rd floor, and this booking was confirmed by e mail. When we arrived my niece was given a tiny single-bedded, dark, dingey room on the first floor. When I complained they moved her to a double-bedded room on the 2nd Floor - but unortunately this was also dark, dingey and very small. The window faced on to a brick wall in the centre of the building, and consequently the room was very noisy. We were told that there were no Superior rooms available on the 3rd Floor that day (this was a Monday) but that they could possibly move her again on the Tuesday. There was no point in arguing at the time as the Man on the Desk was very unhelpful. Our next complaint was that on previous visits there had been porters to assist with the luggage (my husband is registered disabled) but there were none in attendance during the 4 days that we were at the hotel, and no other member of staff offered to help. Also, with no explanation, the Blue Bar (one of the features of the hotel) was closed on the Monday evening. On the Tuesday and Wednesday (day and night) the 'historic' restaurant was also closed, with no explanation. We were told that we could eat in the Blue Bar, which was then open. We did not feel inclined to pay restaurant, silver-service prices for a meal served in a public bar, with wooden tables, draughts and uncomfortable chairs, so we ate out instead. To sum up - this time hotel was grossly understaffed; the service was appalling (apart from one young man on Reception); the corridors smelt badly of drains and neglect; it was very disconcerting to see a Rentokil van parked outside the hotel on the Tuesday; the price of the rooms was way too high (compared to other local hotels) considering the low standard. This hotel should not be advertised as 4 star. We will not be returning to this hotel again -ever. Sad, but true

Reviews.Title: “Avoid This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jbaflyer
Reviews.Content: I have traveled the world on a moderate budget, and never seen such a rip-off for what they charge. The hotel is not in the best of areas, which can be overlooked. Upon entering the hotel, the lobby furniture is run down but clean. I paid 200 USD a night in off season and was given the room. It was adjacent to an alley, the room was extremely small for european standards, and smelled. I went downstairs and asked them for a clean room, they were nice, gave me another room, and still the same conditions. The linens, the carpet, everything is something you'd expect on skid row. I am not picky, but the place stinks of run down and over used. I told the front desk I could not stay, and they said since I booked the hotel through expedia they would not refund any monies - understandable. I complained to expedia for having such a substandard hotel, (been booking with them for 10+ years never a problem, and I only was refunded one night) Lastly, I walked up the street to The Crown Plaza, asked for a room, received a large room for 139 USD a night that borders on a 5 star. IF you are reading this, check with The Crown Plaza first, the room is superior, clean and can I say more other than AVOID Die Port van Cleve Hotel at all cost. Additionally, if you are wondering I never write reviews but felt this one was necessary to avoid others from making the same mistake I did.

Reviews.Title: “never ever stay here”
Reviews.Author: natasha23
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Dei Port Van Cleve in early November 2009, it is a good location right in the centre opposite Dam Square. On arrival they didnâ€™t have a room that we booked, they had us down as a double when we booked a twin room. They then gave us an â€œup-gradeâ€� what crap.they gave us a room that had half windows and was so dark and dingy. 4 star yeah right. We then came back from a night out to find a MOUSE in the room. Yes a MOUSE. The hotel werenâ€™t surprised and tried to tell me that it was due to the metro system being built. That said I was not impressed. They should have provisions for this or close the hotel. After a long negations with the manager they finally gave us another room which was worse than the first room and yes youâ€™ve guessed it. It was an â€œupgradeâ€�. This is not a 4* hotel in any way shape or form. This hotel was a 1* with a good location. At best it is good for students and back packers. Please please donâ€™t spend any money staying here there are many other places to stay than this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “not a good hotel do not stay there if you are a family”
Reviews.Author: seldamanawi
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel for a family. we have a baby, and they put us in a shoe box room with no ventilation right above the entrance where a lot of people smoke outside, so the room consistently smelt of smoke. staff were not welcoming. we did not enjoy the hotel at all. Good things about the hotel were the tv has English channels, the breakfast included salmon (i love salmon), and it was really close to the main attractions... that's it!!!

Reviews.Title: “overpriced boxroom”
Reviews.Author: kit59Scotland
Reviews.Content: ths hotel is extremely overpiced to stay in what i could only describe as a shoebox- the rate didnt even include breakfast!!- 3 nights cost Â£380 !!!- stairs were steep to all floors- lifts old-would definately NOT recommend this hotel- this was a late honeymoon break- glad we had so many sights to go and see !!!!! hotel not for relaxing in- very misleading

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location near Dam Square”
Reviews.Author: NJphotoGuy
Reviews.Content: I chose the Die Port van Cleve because of a good room rate. I asked for a quiet room and was assigned one in the back of the hotel that faced the road. It was busy all night and I didn't get a good night's rest. The free internet connection worked well. On my last night, I had the numbered steak in the bar (the restaurant was closed). It was expensive, but tasted nice. For breakfast, I went across the street to the corner bar for the English Breakfast for 6.50 euro. Coming from the station, the number 2 tram stopped right in front of the hotel. The location is ideal, a block from Dam Square. Other attractions, like the Anne Frank house, are a short walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Blairso
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated behind the Royal Palace on Dam Square, with a tram stop at the front door. City centre location makes it an excellent location for everything.

Reviews.Title: “Very decent & well positioned.”
Reviews.Author: costaspal
Reviews.Content: Although it is not a big, fancy hotel it served me just fine for my 5-day stay there (half business / half leisure). Nice Restaurant at the lobby for breakfast or any meal during the day along with the "traditional" small Bar at the other side of the Hotel's entrance. Well positioned with respect to transportation and many sightseeing sites. Walkable distance (10-15 min.) from the Central RR.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - but old worn-down hotel, and windows cannot be opened”
Reviews.Author: DkCph
Reviews.Content: As the title says, its a great location - central to everything. We stayed there for 4 days, and we can only recommend this hotel IF you get the rooms to a discounted price. It said when we book the hotel, that it would be a 4* hotel, however it should not be rated to more than a 3* hotel. The rooms are old and it seems that no refurbishment of the rooms has ever occurred - besides the toilet, which seemed new'ish... The worst thing about the rooms in this hotel is that the windows CANNOT be opened, and there are NO Air-condition in the rooms...so the only way to get fresh air is to open the door to the corridor... and that is NOT very nice :-(

Reviews.Title: “Great location, slightly dirty rooms.”
Reviews.Author: jessicafred
Reviews.Content: This is in a great location; 5 minutes from Dam Square, 10 minutes from Anne Frank Museum. The Van Gogh museum is further at about a 25 minute walk. Our room was tiny, with barely any room to move around the luggage and beds. There were giant stains on the curtains and light shades, but it didn't bother me enough to ask for another room. Luckily the bathroom was very clean. The people next to us were in a non-smoking room, but were smoking pot every night -- just know that that might happen. Definitely ask for a room away from the street. We were located in the back, but there was still noise from outside. I imagine, though, that it would have been a lot louder out front. Staff was very nice and attentive. Still, great deal considering the price we paid and the location.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in great location”
Reviews.Author: BostonTraveler62
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel in an excellent location walking distance from Central Station and near to all attractions. We paid only EU 70 per night, a real bargain. The room was small and had little closet space but it was clean and quite adequate for a couple of nights. There was a full bathtub, safe, TV, and electric teamaker. The staff was pleasant and helpful. The restaurant is terrible and breakfast costs EU 12.50 extra. But there are lots of cafes and restaurants around.

Reviews.Title: “\great Location”
Reviews.Author: alice43Southport
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights. The staff were more then helpful and polite. The room was clean no a/c but a fan provided and needed. Kettle and plenty of tea and coffee etc. Bathroom very clean new towels every day and complimentery toiletries lovely. Sheets changed half way through stay.Beds very comfy. Only down side was that on their suggestion we booked a meal in the restaurant on our last night. We went down and found it closed so we had to eat in the bar which is lovely with the Delft Tiles but not as comfy. We were not the only ones to have to do that it was the same menu however and the bar man was lovely working very hard doing the restaurant work as well.

Reviews.Title: “more mouse than disney”
Reviews.Author: gogh_gogh
Reviews.Content: Yep, Great location, friendly staff, complementary pet mice.... We had a great time here until we started to notice how many mice we had in our room. At one point we actually had two on video, so I only recommend this hotel for real animal lovers.

Reviews.Title: “Die port van cleve”
Reviews.Author: MissGaGa
Reviews.Content: A man approached us at the train station when we arrived with a great deal for a hotel and it happened to be right in the center of Amsterdam, we had a huge gorgeous room and were really well looked after.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Whitelondon
Reviews.Content: Just back from a short break in Amsterdam. I stayed in this hotel and from the very moment we checked in until we left we received a professional service with a smile especially in reception. I travel a lot due to my business and have to say that compared to other hotels, the service here is outstanding. Restaurant experience was not bad, however sometimes staff seem to be busy with lists and counting their own float instead of paying attentin to guests. Rooms need fresh up, as the furniture style, what they called "classic dutch" is looking old and outdated, which belong somewhere to the past.

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated”
Reviews.Author: Scalf
Reviews.Content: There is far better accomodation in the city for the same price. Don't be fooled by the location or fancy exterior. The rooms are very basic and the bar and restaurant are fine althought hte former specializes in Dutch food which is meat and more meat. However when we were there in a party of 24 they only had 12 steaks in stock. The staff are superb and its a great location for last minute gift shopping next door in the plaza. Wouldn't stay here again though.

Reviews.Title: “MAUSE EAT OUR CHEESE AND CHOCOLATE !!!”
Reviews.Author: travelerka
Reviews.Content: Terrible 4 star (???!!!) hotel on great location. Very small rooms without mini bar, with plastic curtain in bathroom and MAUSES who jumped all night across the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, 3 star standard”
Reviews.Author: LondonTravelAgent
Reviews.Content: As I got a great industry discount at this hotel I cannot really complain, the only thing I would say is that my room was very small with no view and those annoying windows that hardly open at all. Also, everyday when I came back to the room the key card did not work! Apparently this can be caused by being near mobile phones but having to go back to reception and queue daily is a bit of a chore and this needs to be fixed or replaced with normal keys! Breakfast is expensive at EUR19 per person but you can eat as much as you like, hot and cold breakfast so it's worth it if you're hungry and the restaurant is very nice. There is no parking at this hotel and parking in the city centre is expensive - use Park and Ride. I would reccommend this hotel but only if paying under EUR100 per night as there are no frills, just an excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: vikingCopenhagen
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right next to the Dam Sqare. The staff is friendly, speaks english and are very helpfull. The breakfast buffet is excellent, with a wide variety of food and drinks to choose from. The quality of the food is fine. The rooms are clean and the beds are comfortable. The tv carries many channels and english / us shows are in english with dutch subtitles. Unfortunataly CNN is not available which is sad as the hotel is of such high standards. The nearest supermarket is a big Albert Hejn located less the 2 minutes away from the hotel. Just turn right as you exit the entrance and walk straigh ahead. The nearest ATM machine is on the DAm Square. The tram stop rigtht outside the hotel. The No. 2 goes straight to the Rijksmuseum and the Van Gogh museum and passes the Leidsplein and other shopping areas. As you are in the heart of Amsterdam all shopping and dining can be found within a 2 kilometer radius. This is an excellent hotel to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “MOUSE IN OUR ROOM”
Reviews.Author: delly25
Reviews.Content: I agree with everything the previous reviewer has said, this hotel really isnt worth a visit. We stayed in the hotel for 4 nights, its in a good location and bar and lobby are pleasant too. But its tired and run down and not 4 star. kettle didnt work in our room either I asked for it to be fixed twice and was told we were on an engineers list . On our second day a MOUSE jumped across my luggage and under the table in our room this to me is absolutely unacceptable by any standards, seeing vermon climbing over my suit case was terrible, and it could easily have contaminated my belongings, which really is a health and safety issue for this hotel. It makes my skin crawl.To make matters worse, when I ran down to reception the 2 blonde girls at the desk, made me feel like I was making a big deal, and basically couldnâ€™t care less, and didnâ€™t seem surprised the hotel had mice. I was told the hotel was fully booked, and they stood ignoring me and checking for rooms, they offered another room with 2 single beds.I asked would we be compensated and she said she would contact us later, very unhelpfulâ€¦.surprise surprise she never did, so we packed up and moved all our luggage, the whole experience runied our stay. The room we moved to was adequate, but the windows didnâ€™t open so it was unbearably hot. Having not heard any feed back about the mice by the next night or if anyone caught it, I spoke to Ian on reception who was very helpful and offered to get Kris to contact us the next morning which she did. Kris was apologetic and offered to move us again, which we declined as it was our last night. We did get complimentary breakfast which was very nice. I was told by reception staff the exterminators come 3 times a week to the hotel to deal with the mouse problem. If I had of known this I wouldnt have stayed here. I loved amsterdam and the location of the hotel but would recommend it to anyone, its not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Over rated for a standard room, needs updating all over.”
Reviews.Author: TransportRap
Reviews.Content: Expensive and boring dark, dusty and hairy!!! standard room. Arrogant staff and horribly overpriced breakfast for 19â‚¬. Difficult to figure this as a four star hotel really.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: passengerinthenight
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of its location and we were not dissappointed - it's good for the Central Station and all of the central area. Trams stop right outside and Dam Sq and most other central attractions are just minutes away. The food is good but expensive. There are other eating and drinking places nearby. Hotel is clean and staff were helpful and friendly. We were surprised that there was no shampoo in the bathroom ! - it should be at the prices at this hotel !

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Klemensito
Reviews.Content: It's central but expensive, worn and not worth it. Breakfast: Expensive and boring - as the room.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyable stay with good dutch character”
Reviews.Author: lovetocookMoray
Reviews.Content: had a thoroughly good 3 night stay in room 222. room wasnt luxury but comfortable and clean, also the bathroom was good. enjoyed going out onto the stone balcony leading out the french doors and drinking in the atmosphere of the bustling street outside especially after dark seeing the floodlit building, once the doors were shut all the loud noise from outside dissapeared. loved the steak meal in the restaurant, young waitress was super and took me through to see the blue and white tiles in the bar as i hadnt been in there , i was amazed by the sight. the man at reception was very helpful and polite and answered all our questions about the places we wanted to visit, he marked all on a map for us so we wouldnt forget. it wasnt even a problem when my husband and i came rolling in at er rather a late hour from a fantastic (hic) pub in the centre of amsterdam. i think the people who wrote the bad reviews must have made a mistake about the name of the hotel ( or maybe they spent too long in a pub in the town , got so drunk that they got back to a different hotel, that wasnt good!) would stay in this hotel again if i was visiting amsterdam. it was great being so near all the places we wanted to see, and it was a welcome break to quickly nip back when our feet were aching to recharge the batteries again ready to go out and enjoy more of this amazing place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: NorthYorksFoxy
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a short stay at the Die Port Van Cleve Hotel in Amsterdam. The hotel is situated approx. 10 mins walk from the railway station which has great links from the airport. From landing to the hotel was just an hour, including passport control and waiting for luggage! The hotel itself is well situated just behind the Palace with all the advantages of that location with none of the noise or distractions of the Dam area. Having taken an early flight I was hoping just to be able to leave our bags at the concierge until we could book in. However, the on-duty manager said it was no trouble to take our room early. Although the first room that we were allocated to was not ready the manager was very apologetic and â€˜make it up to usâ€™ by upgrading our room choice. We had dinner in the brasserie and, although quiet, it was an excellent meal. I can recommend the 'numbered' steak with a choice of sauces, potatoes and a visit to the salad bar. The restaurant manager gave us a potted history of the hotel and a tour of the bar that had once been part of the original Heiniken brewery. I must also mention the housekeeping staff - because we never saw them! Just people who did their jobs to a very high standard without being obvious. This is also worthy of high praise. All in all I can recommend this hotel without reservation. Not just because we were given a room upgrade but because of the way a mishap was handled by the staff, the cleanliness of the whole hotel and it's location.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth its * Rating - Didn't Quite Get This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Amandamanx
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights with friends - very overpriced - rooms dated and stuck in the 70's G-Plan. Mould in the bathroom, dirty stained carpets and a dressing table that hadn't been cleaned behind in months - empty crisp packets etc., and coke can left under the bed. Dull, dark room that was depressing to be in - so only spent time in it sleeping - corridors very dated. Front desk not particularly helpful or friendly - nice front hall but that is about it, at 90.00 (uk pound) a night excluding taxes and not including breakfast it was very disappointing and I am sure there are alot more friendlier hotels with better rooms and facilities than this hotel - very disappointing

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jhammett17
Reviews.Content: This was our first stop during our 2 week trip to Europe. The hotels is nice. Our rom was very clean, as well as the bathroom. It is in a nice loaction where the Dam Square is about 5 minutes away if that. You can easliy walk to other attractions, like Maddam Tussauds Wax Museum, and the Anne Frank House. On our first night we got a room with a view of the Royal Palace, basically the front side of the hotel. It was great and all, but the only problem was, you could not open the window. It wouldn't have been a problem, if it wasn't the middle of summer. It just got hot and way to stuffy in there since there is no air conditioning. We asked the front desk to give us another room, which they were able to do immediately. It was still nice but no view. That was fine with us though. As long as we had fresh air. As far as food, there are so many lil' cafe shops that have good food for cheap. We never ate in the restaurant downstairs since we wanted to save money. I recommend getting the Lasagne in any of the cafes they were all super delicious!! Overall, I liked the hotel. I would definitely stay there again!!!

Reviews.Title: “I Will Never Stay There Again”
Reviews.Author: Traveler00173
Reviews.Content: Careless and clumsy porters, management that brush you off with excuses. I was asked whether I would like my items to be taken to the room by the porter, to which I said yes ( unfortunately ). I was left with Â£450.00 worth of damage and when I contacted the management they brushed me off with excuses and said that they take no responsibility for lose or damage which is a joke as it's there staff that course the damage. The rooms are also to hot and do not have air conditioning.

Reviews.Title: “A Poor Choice”
Reviews.Author: Jas046
Reviews.Content: Not a good hotel. Very small rooms. No hard soap. both soap dispensers were broken and never fixed; even after I reported to the manager. Towels with holes in them. Chairs in the room were strained. No wash cloths. The manager did bring us some after I talked to him.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: hil68
Reviews.Content: Myself and a friend stayed here for four nights in June 08. Having read some terrible reviews, we didnt really know what to expect. However we found the hotel to be clean, the staff friendly, efficient and helpful and of course the location excellent. We would recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not my idea of a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: vanmunchen
Reviews.Content: Good, central location but the room was depressingly small and dingy with no air conditioning. I found someone's sock on the floor so cleaning standards were obviously poor. Tea and coffee facilities were provided in the room, as well as a safe but no minibar. Good choice of TV programmes. Bathroom was fine. I had an evening meal in the expensive restaurant but the quality was not up to the price. Good choice of buffet breakfast. I was only there for one night and certainly would not have wanted to stay longer. The hotel certainly does not warrant 4 stars - I have stayed in vastly better 3 star hotels.

Reviews.Title: “A very good experience”
Reviews.Author: Michael15
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in the last week of May, 2008. It was a very positive experience. The bar is excellent and the barman, Joe, the barman on duty most of the time when I was there, was a fantastic host and a very good member of staff. In fact, all of the staff I came across were very good. I didn't have breakfast, but did have an evening meal and it was great. The restaurant is beautiful and is well set out. The bar is a wonderful room too and I found it to be very relaxing. The rooms do need to be brought more up to date and the corridor on the fifth floor does need redecorating, but I spent very little time in my room anyway, so it really didn't matter a great deal to me. The room was extremely clean and I found that the hotel was very quiet and I slept very soundly, which is unusual for me. The location is superb. I would recommend this hotel without hesitation. The beers in the bar are also good. The whole experience was a relaxed one and it greatly added to my enjoyment of a wonderful city. One other bar I really liked and would highly recommend for its superb- and I mean superb- Dutch beers, is 't Arendsnest on Herensgracht, about ten minutes walk from the hotel. Go up the Raadhuistraat and turn right at the second bridge. It's a lovely bar and the beer was just amazing-espcially their own brew, Zwaluw! It is another bar with a very good atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably BAD.... dont darken the door”
Reviews.Author: BrucieS
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to Die Port Van Cleve, the occasion being to celebrate my girlfriends recent birthday a few weeks ago, after the first visit a few years ago I did not hesitate to return as this had been a most enjoyable stay and I hoped for the same. Unfortunately our the other weekend was far from that and I would have huge reservations about the hotel as a going concern. The following goes through my visit and subsequent problems in chronological order: - My girlfriend and I checked in on Friday evening at about 6pm or so, were greeted by a male member of staff whose name I unfortunately do not recall, I was asked as normal for credit card verification, this appeared to be completed correctly and we were directed to our room. Unfortunately this room was a twin room and was not what I had booked and had confirmation for from my reservation, I had requested a double. This issue was soon rectified and we were moved to room 407. - We were planning to go out that Friday evening and my girlfriend took a shower, when she came out she said the shower was too hot and she had huge difficulty adjusting the temperature correctly having nearly burnt herself on a few occasions. I showered after and found the adjustment on the shower far too sensitive also â€“ I would consider this dangerous. - The next issue we experienced was that the lighting in the room was not sufficient as at least one of the bulbs on the bedside light was blown. - We then went out for some dinner and a few beers during which at approximately 10 - 11pm I got a telephone message from my credit card company that I was to call them immediately. I did so and I was transferred to card security directly, they were considerably concerned about four transactions which had been either attempted or completed from Die Port Van Cleve. The first three transactions attempted to take â‚¬600 from my account, the final attempted a transaction for â‚¬49,883.33. These transactions obviously drew serious attention from the credit card company and they advised to return to the hotel immediately and possibly call the police, following which I should call them back and advise if the card should be cancelled. At this stage they also advised that my credit limit had been exceeded and there were no funds available on my card, I was extremely shocked and rang the hotel immediately. I found and still find it very hard to understand how these four transactions had been required when all I was aware of at check in was a credit verification, i.e. a confirmation that funds were available in my account. At no stage during the check in process was I made aware that a transaction was being completed and at no stage did I authorize by signature or pin that funds should be transferred. I was also very surprised at the figure of the transactions, at â‚¬600 this was â‚¬130 more than my room rate less local tax? This is aside from the fact that four different transactions were attempted on the card and a final transaction of â‚¬49883.33? but I am struggling to understand why and how this was used a payment amount? In any case after a discussion with the hotel there was little I could do that evening and was more than extremely annoyed. - Not least because I would be unable to use my credit card for dinner and for the remainder of my time in Amsterdam. - There was a final surprise on this visit for my girlfriend which again was a complete embarrassment, this happened on Saturday evening. I had gone downstairs for a beer before going out for dinner, she was getting ready to go out and while looking for a shoe she came across a used condom sitting under our bed. She immediately came down stairs to let me know and I made Nina aware of the situation. This was something that I would hope to never encounter anywhere let alone in a 4* hotel room. At this stage I also made Nina aware of the lighting and shower problems in the room, she said there was little she could do at that time aside from remove the condom. The only gesture during our entire stay in the hotel was that we were offered a late check out on Sunday and this was only after I had asked what time I could check out! At no time during the stay was a manager made available to discuss the situation, I subsequently found out that one was available for a period on Saturday afternoon from Christa during check out but he/she was not directed toward me? I am shocked that this would not have been a priority given the level of incompetency and carelessness shown with my credit card. I cannot say how embarrassed and annoyed I was during the weekend, I recommended this hotel to my girlfriend and told her it would be more than suitable for our stay in Amsterdam for her birthday celebration. Nearly as annoying was the inconvenience of having to pay cash for the weekend and also the fact I was also hoping to buy some items during our visit in Amsterdam but as my credit card limit was exceeded this was impossible. At this stage the more I think about it the more I am annoyed. This is not what I would expect from a 4* hotel anywhere in the world let alone in Europe. DO NOT CONSIDER THIS HOTEL IF STAYING IN AMSTERDAM. I have since been in contact with one of the managers and am now waiting over two weeks for an appropriate compensation for this shambles of a stay.... they seem totally incompetent.

Reviews.Title: “awful bedrooms, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Boblin
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because it was central, and looked a little different to the norm. It was indeed beautiful and the reception was very nice. We arrived about 10.30pm and booked in. The staff are great but the dissapointment when we reached our room was dreadful. The room was little more than a cupboard. It was dark and dingy and with 70's style furniture. The bedding however was lovely cotton and very comfortable, the bathroom was clean and acceptable, however we couldnt have stayed in there. I was offered another room which we gladly took but quickly realised there was a strange patch on the ceiling that looked liked there had been a leak and the television didnt work. We moved again to a room that was okay. It at least had a good window. We were offered 3 other rooms before we took this one. I should say at this point that we like nice surroundings but are not normally very fussy, but expected better from the information given. This place, with its wonderful location, could be the cream of the hotels in Amsterdam but needs a good refurbishment. The staff could not have been more helpful especially the porter on that night. Over the better things - the bar is beautiful, again with great staff and breakfast was very nice. Would we go there again? No, but thanks to the staff for helping out.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel would recommend-(ask for 5th floor.)”
Reviews.Author: LordMemnoch
Reviews.Content: Booked 2 rooms here for 3 nights from apr 17th to 20th. 2 couples travelling. A taxi to the hotel cost us about â‚¬55. Doesnt look great from the outside-but the old saying about judging a book by its cover springs to mind. Inside is really warm and welcoming. Our room was on the fifth floor and was really bright and was a decent size. We had 3 steps going down to the bedroom from a short little hall way inside the door. Bed was big and comfortable. Room had no air conditioning though so we did have to leave the window open a lot. I read reports of the place looking tired and dated-I didnt think this at all. Room was clean and didnt look out of date at all. View from the window was a rooftop but thats not a big deal (if you want to see something go outside). The second room was on the 4th floor and seemed a lot smaller (all one level didnt have the corridor and steps). The other couple commented on the differance in room size. Both rooms were booked at the same time and booked exactly the same. To be honest I wouldnt have been as happy with my friends room. On site is the famous steak restaurant. Wasnt great. You can order either a 6oz or 9 oz steak done to your liking (or so they say) and its served with veg and fries. The steak itself wasnt anything special to be honest and wasnt quite well done as requested. That was a disapointment as we had heard so many good things about it. The room service menu was pretty standard. (standard as in choice-food was nice). Beware of the room service breakfast though-its very expensive and not nice. Special mention goes to the barman Jorge (spelling?) who was great. The hotel bar was really cool and we favoured staying there over any of the bars/clubs around the city. Real old-fashioned set-up-wooden tables candles etc. Reception staff were really helpful at both check-in and check-out and helping us with directions and travel advice. Hotel location is great with in easy walking distance to Anne Frank, Madame Tussuads, shopping area and Red Light District. There is a large shopping mall and supermarket on the same street. There is a Tram stop outside the hotel and Centraal Station is 10 minutes walk away. Id would definatly recommend this hotel, it was a little more expensive than some of the others we checked but then it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but not 4*”
Reviews.Author: strasman
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located just 8 mins walk from the central station. A tram also stops outside the front door. 3 mins walk from Dam square. Sourrounded by restaurants so you will not be stuck for somewhere to eat. The rooms are on the small side and the hotel could do with a smarten up. Rooms are clean and comfortable and pretty well equipped. Be prepared for a disturbed night as the trams run late and passers by from the local hostelliers all through the night. But what can you expect as you are in the centre of the city. Staff are friendly and the hotel boasts flat screen TV's and wireless internet. There is also a good bar attached to the hotel serving several local beers. If you can get a good rate then stay here. It advertises itself as 4 star but I would only rate it as 3 star. Bear this in mind when booking.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: dimitra12000
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 4 nights during February 2008. The booking was made through a travel agency in Greece, and though I have asked for a double bed front view room, mine was twin and had no view. Before booking the hotel I had read several reviews, for small and not clean rooms. The room was very clean and renovated but a little bit small.. People on the reception desk were very helpful. Breakfast was plain, but nice and the staff also polite. We had one lunch there, so as to taste the famous filet, which was to our disappoinment bad and very expensive. A problem that we had is that due to a cancellation of our flight, all the group had to stay one extra night and the new room that we were given was so small, that had no closet and only one person could standing be around the bed at the same time. Apart from that, the room had old casings and it was very cold and noisy. Generaly the hotel was very noisy. You could hear peoples' steps from the corridor or from the room upstairs. Another thing, is that during check in the reception desk asked for our credit card for guarantee of any extras, which is common and acceptable, but without mini bar in the rooms (for an example), what consumptions can you make??? Overall the hotel in a very nice location in central Amsterdam, with bus and tram stop just outside and just 5 minutes on foot from the central train station, near the market etc. Would visit it again, provided that I would have a larger room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, value and location”
Reviews.Author: DCMark
Reviews.Content: The Port Van Cleve is wonderfully located near the action yet on a very safe and open street. Minutes from the Red Light district and 8 minutes from the train station. Staff is helpful, kind and efficient. Rooms are not large but totally adequate. Room size is typical of what you would get in a large city hotel (NYC, Paris, etc). Building is beautiful from the outside too. Rooms are very, very clean too.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't even get through the door”
Reviews.Author: leased
Reviews.Content: While trying to book a room at this hotel I was subjected to possibly the worst customer service I have ever encountered. they weren't prepared to book something as simple as a feb 29th of a leap year. The sad thing is it wasn't just one person it was also management! Then proceeded to tell me that it was my fault that I didn't understand why and i would get it if i was in the hotel industry. what? the hotel industry doesn't believe in leap years?

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheDamMaster
Reviews.Content: Well where do i start?, this hotel was a experience EXCELLENT was about 10-15 mins walk from the train station (dam square) you can get a tram but we walked. it is right in the centre of dam square, on the road to the clubs (by tram/taxi ) not far from the cafes and red light area also the shopping streets are on the doorstep (very handy) the hotel is excellent, customer service is great, we didnt have no problems, we had a 3 bedroom room on the 2nd floor, the view of the street loads of windows very big room, bathroom was excellent CLEAN you can smoke as well, we also had a 2 bed room on the second floor, the view was not to great but the room was very clean. the staff were very helpfull and we had a very nice stay will book again when we next go ??? many thanks

Reviews.Title: “Hotel at Dam Square”
Reviews.Author: breukelenman
Reviews.Content: This is an average hotel with a great location. It is located almost directly behind the Royal Palace at Dam Square in the heart of Amsterdam. If location is important for you, then this is a good pick. You can even walk to this hotel from the Centraal Railway Station (just walk along Damrak Street and turn right at the Dam Square; then walk past the palace and New Church and you'll see it right across the street). Much of the city's best attractions will be a short walk or tram ride away!! Our room was small and somewhat ordinary. There was no AC, and downstairs is a bar and restaurant. The restaurant is noted for it's steaks, which are good, but the manager we dealt with needed some lessons in dealing fairly with the public!!! We arrived and ordered our food before a large group of italian tourists showed up, but they got priority and their food before us. When we complained to the manager (a woman) she basically said we were being dishonest by claiming we arrived before the tour group. We were not!!! She then declined to give us a complimentary drink which our waiter suggested to her that we should have. POOR service indeed! Still, I would recommend this hotel to a friend if you're not looking for too many amenities and extras.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but showing its age”
Reviews.Author: Gazefc
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel before, this time i stayed with my girlfriend for one night on 26th Dec 07. The location is fantastic, just off Dam Sq, very easy to get too. The front of the hotel is grand, with a restaurant and bar on either side of the entrance. Reception, is good and the staff are professional and friendly. We where given a room on the first floor , and the first thing we noticed where the thread bare carpets, these continued down the corridor. We had booked a double room direct with the hotel, but the room consisted of two single beds pushed together, not even made up or 'zipped' together, this was very poor. i have had this issue before with this hotel, when i stayed with a friend of mine (male), and where given a double bed , which they just seperated..!!! it claims to be 4 star..a long way short of that , would just be a 3 !!

Reviews.Title: “[--] 5/5”
Reviews.Author: Vinegarhill
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel via easyjet while booking the flights. Prior to booking the flights i enquired direct with the hotels own website and found it to be quite expensive so was surprised to find it on the easyjet website much cheaper than direct. We picked this hotel because we had been several times previously to the bar which if this website had been baradvisor.co.uk it would have a 5/5. The bar really is worth a visit and we have always found the staff to be above average. That goes for all the staff throughout the hotel - in our experience anyway. The breakfeast is plentiful and good quality. The problem i had was with the room - it was clean but really lets the rest of the experience down. It was minute {room 508} and in desperate need of a renovation - we actually got the impression that we were on the easyjet no frills floor getting the discounted room in line with the standard of the rooms within the hotel - even the hallway to our room was in need of decoration - this differed to the other hallways we looked at. While there for two nights we ate at the fondue restaurant which was just across the road and up slightly - unfortunatly if you have difficulty with stairs you need not visit as i could only describe the access as a cross between a ladder and a stair - that said we really enjoyed the meal and the surroundings. The second night we went to Haesje Claes on spuistraat which we have visited several times and have never been disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “five star location two star room”
Reviews.Author: minicooperdownunder
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night only November 6 2007 as the hotel I originally booked through Expedia didnâ€™t have a room for me and put me here for the first night, they paid for a taxi there and back the next day. The hotel I was originally booked into was in one of the suburbs, Zandaam so this unplanned stay gave me a better opportunity to see the central part of Amsterdam without having to worry about cathching the last train back to Zandaam. The hotel as most reviews have said is in a great location, close to Dam Square, Red Light District, Anne Frank House, main railway station and most other things that you want to see when you are in Amsterdam. There is public transport right outside the hotel and I didnâ€™t hear any noise from it mainly because I had one of the inner rooms that only has a small window that looks out across a courtyard to another room, although if you stuck your head out of the room and looked right you could see the outside world. I had room 526 which was on the very small side so small that the closet for your clothes didnâ€™t have a hanging rail just hooks that you hung your clothes on as it wasnâ€™t deep enough to take clothes on the normal way. The room was clean and well equipped LCD TV, comfortable bed but virtually no where to store anything or sit down except at a very small desk. I think like a lot of hotels in Amsterdam this hotel is an amalgamation of a number of adjoing buildings and the rooms carved out of them. Canâ€™t comment on value for money as I only paid the rate for the hotel that couldnâ€™t accommodate me for my first night. The hotel staff were friendly and efficient and were able to answer the questions I had. Didn't eat at the hotel and didn't use any of the facilities the hotel has so can't comment on them. Not sure I would want to spend much time in my dark, tiny room, but I guess if you are in Amsterdam you are not spending much time in your room anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Karchristi
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of its location and it was advertised as a 4 star hotel. Yes, the location is good, close to Dam Square and within walking distance of many attractions. Our room was very dark (almost depressing) plus the lampshades were a dark brown colour - made it very difficult to read. I did complain and after telling the staff I worked in the travel industry and would be putting in a report about the hotel - they gave me an upgrade! The new room was much lighter but this hotel is only 2.5 or 3 star at the most. I found the staff to be polite and friendly. The breakfast was very good. They offer a wide choice of food. I would suggest you shop around before you book this hotel. All the rooms need renovation. It is a pity that this hotel was not up to scratch as the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place and Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Quass
Reviews.Content: It's a bit pricey for what you get, but the staff is very friendly and the hotel appears to have been recently rennovated. The location is safe and close to where you want to site see. We exceeded our check out time but the staff was very forgiving. I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful on the outside. Inside, not so much.”
Reviews.Author: jaypeaohh
Reviews.Content: I loved how this place looked in the pictures. And it does look awesome when you get there. The bar that's attached to it is fantastic. It's close to the Dam, the Red Light, and the Anne Frank House which is all good. That said, my room sucked. Innerfacing room with windows that stared into other people's rooms and the hallway. Zero natural light. I only slept there, but if you're going to enjoy a room, book another place or get a view. I only paid about $130 dollars through Expedia, but if you're thinking of paying more than that, you might want to look at other hotels and go to the Die Port for a drink at the bar.

Reviews.Title: “truly awful!”
Reviews.Author: Mellow_40
Reviews.Content: I have to admit I was slightly sceptical before arriving at this hotel. City centre, old...... It took me three attempts to get a room, the first was smoking, when my booking had specified non-smoking, " we can't guarantee a non smoking room, we need a medical certificate!". Not a lot of good telling you that at 23.30. Next room had someone else's stuff already in there. The only hotel I have woken up in and thought that I wasn't sure about leaving my case and belongings there. Very, very poor. Tired and run down. Rude staff. And hey, they charge you â‚¬335 per room per night. Avoid at all costs. Complete rip off!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “All that glitters is not 4*”
Reviews.Author: Saffy58
Reviews.Content: My partner and I recently stayed here for two nights on what was intended to be a weekend of luxury for my birthday. On arrival at the hotel which was later than intended due to a pre-booked airport transfer which didn't show up, we were glad to be met by a friendly lass at reception. On the journey to our room on the fifth floor I was initially concerned by the slightly grubby, dated decor of the lift and corridor approaching our room. On entering the room we were soon to discover that our 4* superior double was far from. 1* would be more appropriate. Stains on the ceiling from a flooding, cracked floor tiles in bathroom, battered lampshades and very limited space , 10" either side of the bed, were just a few of the details that made our 'superior' room anything but luxurious. On asking to be moved to something more appropriate we were told that it was not possible though I am convinced that the hotel was not fully booked. The staff were very helpful to a point but this hotel should NOT be classified as a 4* .

Reviews.Title: “4 star?? No way!!”
Reviews.Author: Napoleon72
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for one night on short notice. The hotel is located very close to the Dam Square. Use of public communications are easy as its just three steps away from the door. The rooms are no more than OK. They are a little bit worn out and needs an upgrade. The view from our rooom was straight into a brickwall, and had no a/c so the temp was a a litlle warm during the night. The prize for one room (230 euro) is absurd!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, rooms need upgrading”
Reviews.Author: Paul Tarmas
Reviews.Content: As said before the hotel has agreat location for exploring Amsterdam, I have no complaints about the hotel apart from the room furnishings are looking a little tired and could do with upgrading to make this truly a 4* hotel. The room we had was at the back of the hotel so there was very little noise, it was overlooked by other rooms in the hotel so no view, but this is to be expected in the middle of Amsterdam. The only modern thing about the room was that it had a flat screen t v. But the room and bathroom were of a good size and very clean and tidy with everthing you would need for your stay. All staff were very pleasant and helpful. We had a deal that included breakfast, which was very good and plentiful. So all in all we enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The one thing I would say though was that the rooms have no air conditioning and the room was still quite hot with the window open, and it was not that hot while we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Not so great”
Reviews.Author: bookem28
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife for one night and wasn't overly impressed with the hotel. From the street it looks like a nice old building with a bit of history to it and this feeling continues into the main reception. However, this feeling was lost once we got to our room. Unfortunately our room was very small, just enough to fit a double bed and their was a foul smell coming from the bathroom pipes (we had to keep the bathroom door closed to try and keep the smell out of the bedroom). If we had of being staying longer than one night then we definitely would have asked to change rooms, but it was really only a place for us to sleep before catching a train out of Amsterdam early next morning. The hotel is in a good location, but I doubt that I would stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: L_and_GLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel towards the end of June 2007. The hotel was clean and the room was spacious, the room was split on 2 levels. We managed to get a deal that included breakfast which had a good selection. It would not be worth paying for as it seemed quite expensive for what it was. The staff were nice and spoke excelent English. The hotel was very centrally located (2mins) walk from Dam Square and about 10 minutes walk from the Central Station. If you are traveling to Schipol then get then train from the airport to the main station which takes about 15minutes and then you can walk easily to the hotel. The hotel has a restaurant and bar connected to it and serves a good selection of food all through the day. This was a nice hotel, however I would say that it was not a true 4* hotel but no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Unhappy with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: lily5
Reviews.Content: This was our first stop on a three week vacation and we were very unhappy with this hotel. These were the problems for our two day stay: 1) No telephone service, phones were down for two days, couldn't call room to room or even down to the front desk. 2) Terrible beds, must have used since the opening of the hotel-could feel the springs. 3) Bathroom drains plugged, shower curtain was disguisting 4) Staff were not result oriented however they were very nice. 5) Terrible value- we paid $271 for one night and $325 for the second night. This hotel in comparison to the other hotels (in the same price range) we stayed in for the rest of our vacation was by far the worse value.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location for exploring Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: floorbye
Reviews.Content: It is worth saying that this is not a hotel you'd go to if you want a really upscale, romantic place to stay. BUT the hotel is in an excellent location from which to explore the city of Amsterdam. It's a two minute walk to the Dam Square, 10 minute walk to the Central Station and within easy walking distance of everything in central Amsterdam. The hotel is clean and quiet an comfortable, but I would say the key selling point is the fact that it is so well located.

Reviews.Title: “Beside Magna Plaza Mall, In the back of Nieuwe Kerk”
Reviews.Author: RigodÃ³n
