Reviews.Content: Perfect location, In the middle of Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal, 50 mts from Dam Square. A couple of tram stops from Amsterdam Centraal. According the typical amsterdam buildings, the halls and reception are quite tiny. But, in my opinion, the rooms are fine (I was upgraded to a superior room, with toilette and jacuzzi, that did not work). The rooms could be differents, somes has wooden beams on the roof, and somes are normal ones. The breakfast is taken at the Brasserie â€˜De Poortâ€˜; is fine, not excellent but correct. The most important is you can take it in a table with views (Enormous windows). Lots of Tram lines have stops near the hotel. If you can get it for aprox. 120 EUR is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “...its more of a 3 star hotel ...”
Reviews.Author: SimonMu
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Die Port as a late birthday present from the wife in Feb 2007 As everyone says the location is great - literally 1 minute from Dam Sq and right in the heart of things. Stayed in Room 103 which faced our the back - bit noisy but where wouldnâ€™t be in the middle of Amsterdam? Reception is great, super speedy and the Concierge is a great guy to ask about anything - places to go, how to get there. Excellent English spoken and always has a smiley face. Breakfast is well above average - Help yourself buffet style - Cereals, fresh fruit, cold meats and cheeses, English breakfast, pastries etc etc - eat heartily !! Rooms, as most on the site say, are small by European standards but clean and tidy. New 18â€� LCD flat panel TVs in the room, Tea and Coffee making facility, excellent (free) safe in the room. Ensuite was good â€“ nice supply of hot water and good power from the shower Overall a good hotel, great location. Downstairs (reception, bar and dining room are more impressive than upstairs (rooms) Looks like thereâ€™s tons of websites offering room deals - my suggestion is shop around for the best rates but definitely go there. Recommendations Well in 2 days you're not gonna get a lot done â€“ took a boat trip â€“ Canal Bus â€“ very good - warm, pleasant and a great place to be if it's raining. Make sure you try a â€œrijsttafelâ€� â€“ Indonesian meal consisting of anything from 10 to 30 samples of Indonesian dishes â€“ Try Sarang Mas. Address is Rokin 84 ( www.sarangmas.nl) â‚¬27-32 per person â€“ excellent place, superb ambience and food. Also try Rembrandt Corner of a beer and nibbles â€“ Get off the Canal Bus at â€œLâ€� Waterloo Plein, turn left and it on your RHS just before the bridge. Great beers, great atmosphere and superb food. PS If you're staying at the Die Port try the Magna Plaza shopping mall next door - it has some great shops

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ORDtraverler
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel per the reccomendation of a friend. Hotel has an excellent location. 10 minute fast walk from Central Station. Also, the KLM (Conexion) Airport bus stops here. Note: you must book your bus ride to the airport 2 hrs in advance and can buy tickets at the Lobby desk (12 euro). No need to use the trams, one can walk everywhere. Hint; when you exit the hotel, turn right and there is a full service supermarket one block up. You can also buy stamps at the service desk there for any postcards you may want to send to family or friends. Room and bathroom were clean, basic and no complaints. Ordered 2 hamburgers late one night after partying and they were awful. Avoid room service! Would consider staying here again but no air conditioning in summer!

Reviews.Title: “Looking for a place to stay.....Not here...”
Reviews.Author: Cleve001
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I just returned from Amsterdam and stayed at this hotel.....Well, when we arrived the check in process was fast and the reception staff were very friendly. We went to our room and soon as we opened the door I was not impressed. The room was very small, musty and very out of date. The king size bed that we reguested was two singles put together. The couch was very old and had a slip cover on it and after lifting the cover up I knew why it was on...... No closet space to store your clothes. (if you don't mind living out of a suitcase then its ok..) and no bar fridge. I immediately went down to the front desk to see if we could get another room...After paying 25 euro a night we were upgraded to a guest suite... Room was a lot larger but with all the same characteristics as the first room... Room service...for get about it, our room was cleaned twice in the four nights that we stayed there. When it was cleaned the bed and washroom was the only thing cleaned..They did not restock coffee or give clean coffee cups as we had to wash them ourselves. Renting a movie will cost you 12.50 euro...We asked for a wake up call the morning that we were leaving for the airport and never received it.....We originally were going to book at the Swissotel and after going to see it we should have booked there.... Happy travels

Reviews.Title: “Check out the bar”
Reviews.Author: icepanda
Reviews.Content: We booked a superior room through Expedia for 2 nights and got the third night free. The hotel is really centrally located and our room overlooked the edge of Dam Square. We stayed in room 321 and if staying again would request that room as I noticed a lot of the other rooms did not have so nice a view. The room was large and spacious on a split level which was a pleasant surprise as we had been told rooms in Amsterdam are generally small. A porter is available to take bags to your room. I would say if your room does not contain a fan like ours did to request one as the rooms get really warm in the morning. The bar which was the original Heineken Brewery is lovely and we drank there most nights (nake sure you bring plenty of money though)

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: twist27
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in jan 2007 for three nights, you could not wish for a better location, everything is within reasonable walking distance and for those who don't like to walk there is a tram stop directly outside the hotel. my room was small but clean with tv and tea + coffee making facilities and a safe big enough for a laptop. The bathroom was fine with a good shower. I did not eat in the restaurant as their is plenty of choice in amsterdam, the bar is expensive but a pleasant enough place to meet up or finnish the night. The staff were friendly and helpfull, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints!”
Reviews.Author: harrythedog
Reviews.Content: Reading some of the other reviews after having already booked, my heart sank. But what a pleasant surprise! Even arriving late at night we found courteous, smiling staff and went up to find a clean, comfortable room in the heart of the city! What more do you want? Loved the in-room stereo system (courtesy of the flastcreen TV) too. Breakfast wasn't included in our rate so honestly can't comment on it. Bar prices above average, but not a place you'd spend a whole evening, anyway. We liked the place a lot and would certainly return here.

Reviews.Title: “Amsterdam's best location”
Reviews.Author: jpcheer25
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Die Port van Cleve from November 22-28, 2006. We agree that the location is by far the best in Amsterdam. The hotel is housed in a historical building off of Vorburgwal. It is directly behind the Royal Palace, Niew Kerk, and Dam Square. All of the major tram lines are within steps of the building; though riding the tram was hardly necessary, as a majority of the sights were within a short and enjoyable walk. Our room was very small (even for Europe), but it was comfortable. It had a lot of character and we really enjoyed it. I have read other reviews that state that the rooms smell like mildew. This is probably because everywhere in Amsterdam is surrounded by water. A slight mildew smell should be expected anywhere, especially in historical buildings. Our only complaint was the breakfast. It cost about 18 euro, and was not worth 2 euro. The "hot" food was very cold, and nothing was replenished (even with a full dining room). This was only an inconvenience, because for some reason, Dutch restaraunts don't open until like 11 (even if they do serve breakfast). Being that the hotel restaraunt was the only place open we were very disappointed. We will definitely stay at the Die Port van Cleve, next time we are in Amsterdam...unless we can afford to stay at the Hotel del'Europe, which is where the cast of Ocean's 12 stayed!!! : )

Reviews.Title: “better than expected”
Reviews.Author: bethanny
Reviews.Content: Booked a mini break with my boyfriend. We decided to stay at Die Port Van Cleve as it sounded good and got 3 nights at a discounted rate in a standard double room. However on reading reviews on Trip Advisor prior to going wished we hadn't booked it. We were pleasantly surprised and relieved when we arrived to find a magnificent old building off Dam Square, friendly staff and a lovely, clean, comfortable room. We arrived mid-morning and were delighted to be able to go straight to the room instead of having to wait for it. The room was a good size, modern with flat screen tv, very comfortable beds and a good bathroom with large bath and shower. The room was quiet with sound-proofed windows. Breakfast at the hotel was well worth getting up for and the food served in the restaurant was amazing and reasonable value - the best steak in town! I can definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “4 Star! Don't make me laugh!”
Reviews.Author: Windalicka
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel via one of the agencys on the Damrak, sounded OK as it was supposed to be a 4 Star. Looked Good from the outside, with it's uniformed porter. Booked and paid for a Triple room, but when we arrived found the room was a small shabby double room, badly in need of re decorating. Bathroom was OK, but very small. Rang reception and were told that they couldn't offer us another room, but would put another bed in ASP. After 8 hours and a LOT of phone calls to reception a small camp bed was put in our room, totally blocking access to the wardrobe and the desk. Not at all what you would expect from a so called 4 star hotel. When we booked out and complained, we were offered a 10% discount, but definetely wont be returning. The only good thing about this over priced, shabby, inefficient excuse for a 4 star hotel is it's location, which is only a stones throw from Dam Square. Do yourself a favour and give this place a wide berth.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: nekobaby
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Die Port van Cleve because my boyfriend was attending a conference in Amsterdam and this was where they booked us. I had read reviews prior to going and will say this one thing - while the hotel rooms do not have AC, it is important to note that most hotels/businesses fo not have AC. The weather was unseasonably hot and the hotel was nice enough to put a fan in the room. But the complaint about no AC is common in Amsterdam because AC is rare. That being said, the location was GREAT - right near shopping and the red light district. The hotel was the original Heineken brewery and the hotel bar was very cute. The staff were very helpful. I enjoyed my stay in Amsterdam and at Die Port van Cleve.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Steaks”
Reviews.Author: Matthew_benson83
Reviews.Content: Bought low cost flights and just turned up - walked all the way around Amsterdam - as January is the low season we were bound to find cheap good accommodation and definately found it here - 200 Euros for four nights between us - brilliant!!! The location of this hotel is excellent - right next to Dam Square - excellent - really close to everything you want to see! Hotel was clean/excellent location and good value for money -staff were friendly too. If I go back to Amsterdam I will do exactly the same again - just turn up and see what bargains can be got - really no need to book anything before you go. One piece of advice - when you get out of the main train station in Amsterdam - walk over the bridge - don't go left after the bridge looking for hotels (left = red light district (no nice hotels in there)) Come out of the station and walk straight over the bridge and keep going straight after 5 minutes walk - you get to Dam Square - then find a hotel - there are lots of them to choose from. Should definatetly try eating in the hotel restaurant once - try the steak it is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “no complaints here”
Reviews.Author: kittybroadway
Reviews.Content: after i had booked a room at die port van cleve, i stumbled upon this website looking for other information on amsterdam and, after reading the reviews, i was extremely wary about what i was about to experience. however, i was happily suprised. my brother and i shared a discounted double room for 85 euros a night, not a bad price for central amsterdam. the staff was extremely helpful, friendly and was able to provide information and book pretty much any ticket that we needed during our stay. our room was comfortable, modern, clean and had free internet. perhaps slightly small, but this is europe and die port van cleve is in a historical building. what more can i say, i had a great time and our hotel stay was fantastic. i would highly recommend staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Low Grade Rip Off”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this so-called 4* hotel for the weekend at 250euro/per night. We were given an un-renovated room, strew with scuffed and broken mis-matching furniture and mold in the bathroom. On complaining we were offered a 50euro/night discount, which is more than the vlaue of the room in my view. Exceptionally disappointing with no redeeming features.

Reviews.Title: “Unhappy”
Reviews.Author: ManxieP
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my boyfriend on 12th April till 15th April. We payed 415 euros for our stay there for a Superior Double room and this did not even include breakfast! On arrival we were shown a standard room that you could hardly move in. After compliaining we were shown two more rooms but they were still basic and not what we were promised on internet. We were told we could have an executive room at an extra cost, or be offered a room in their sister hotel near the Airport. On asking to see the manager, we were finally upgraded to the appropriate room. Even though there was a ghastly smell outside the room ( I think due to drainage problems) it did not spoil our holiday, as Amsterdam is lovely!! On our next visit we will not be staying there, as there are much more cheaper places around the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Amsterdam many times and in many different hotels and this was by far the worst - especially for a supposed 4 Star! I had booked a special online deal of â‚¬99 per night and it seems that the hotel keeps the terrible rooms for these deals! The standard double room was the smallest double I have ever stayed in and was also the coldest - so cold in fact that when I went into the bathroom my socked feet left condensation marks on the tiles! The tv packed up half way through the evening and the room service took some time in coming! Would not care to stay here again, however good the deal seems - I have stayed in much nicer 3 Star hotels which are just as central.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I agree with some of the comments posted here - got acheap deal through last minute but it was a dissapointment- half the rooms face a very drab corridor with an antiquated lift ( mind your fingers!) whill the other half is run- down 80's decor.Rooms ok except that we were facing the lightwell, and the noise of the air conditioning kept us awake most of the night. Would have expected post tolietries in a 4 star but had to put up with bolt on shower stuff- Also beds were two singles which means we couldnt sleep together! Ah well you live and Learn!

Reviews.Title: “It IS DEFINITELY as bad as the reviews say”
Reviews.Author: texasdoc01
Reviews.Content: The location is outstanding and the lobby is attractive. Nothing else meets even Motel 6 standards. The rooms are tiny, dirty, worn. My bathroom stank of mildew and urine and the carpet was stained. Furniture looked like worn out Wal Mart particle board stuff from the 1980s. Climate control consists of a radiator and a table fan. This is no 4 star hotel; maybe 1.5 at most.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: scan
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three day stay at this hotel, rated a 4 star it's nearer an average 3 star. The location is great and to be fair you don't spend to much time in your room, which I have to agree with previous comments, a bit tired looking. The bathroom although small had a good shower & hairdryer and was clean.There was also tea & coffee facities in room as there was a free safe.There was the normal T.V. channels you get in most hotels with bbc1 & itv an added bonus + the pay channels.I have to disagree with some comments on the breakfast,I found it more than adequate and set us up for the day,various cerials, mixed fruit the usual cold meat & cheese selection,scrambled & boiled eggs, bacon (proper bacon)sausage,large tomatoes with cheese melted over them, also beans. The apperance of the rooms do let the hotel down & I think that alone loses them that star. If you look around on the net you can get a good rate including breakfast(as I did,try otel or octopus)would use this hotel again if I could get the same rate.

Reviews.Title: “Not As Bad As The Reviews Make Out”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Hotel over 3 nights with my girlfriend over Christmas Day. Had read all the reviews after already buying my ticket. Felt awful as all reviews were so bad and had got this trip as a surprise for my girlfriend. Really not as bad as it was made out. Rooms were cosy, clean and bathrooms to match. Room service was quick and huge purportions of food if bought before 23:00. Traditional style of hotel and attached pub/bar really unique and added a lovely touch to the atmosphere of Amsterdam. We got a real good deal cost wise, so that was a positive slant, so if you can get this at a price cheaper than most then I would go for it. The location speaks for itself and is easily the main selling point. I would go return to Die Port Van Cleve

Reviews.Title: “Oh Dear”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Small, dark, dingy bedrooms. We got a good deal on the net but suffered greatly with the accommodation offered. We moved room after the first night which was an improvement due to its window and you could walk round the bed!! Spent as much time out as to avoid spending time in the room. Hotel bar was good - as long as you are happy drinking on your own!! Next time will consider a 3 star and paying the same rate, as i think 4 stars just over-rate themselves

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Die Port Van Cleven”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Rooms were atrocious. Huge stains on worn-out carpet. Small hanging rack (the only one) broken in closet. Furniture looked like it had been picked up from the street. Pants press falling off wall. View out bedroom window to filthy gutters less than 10 inches from the open window (which barely opened, and of course no A/C). Blinds all bent in bathroom and one set had no rod to open or close. Bathroom windows screwed shut. And this was our second, upgraded room as the first room had a used, unclean toilet. Maid service was efficient. 2 lifts. One broken all 3 days, the other nonfunctional 1-day. And we were in room 425. To be fair, the furniture in the lobby was little better than the furniture in our room. We did have a very good rate through Utell, but were unable to have a double bed as requested through Utell. Reception said this was our fault, as we did not contact the hotel directly. This hotel carried a 4 star rating. I canâ€™t imagine why.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good deal”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Amsterdam. We booked a sister-hotel, the hotel Artemis but since it was overbooked, we were transferred to Die Port van Cleve. They assured us that this also was a 4*hotel, but it was everything but that. It stank in the room; the rooms weren't clean (!!! - something I do care about a lot), the hotel was screaming for a redecoration. The staff was very young (maybe only during holiday periods?) and not well trained. Breakfast was awfull; there wasn't enough sitting room and one had to wait half an hour before coffee was served. Indeed the location was good, but I like a clean room after a day of walking. I would suggest hotel Krasnapolsky, also lying on the dam, which is only a little bit more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID THIS PLACE, what a disgrace!!!”
Reviews.Author: jackiecollins
Reviews.Content: in april of this year my parents came to visit me in holland.as they have never been to amsterdam,i wanted to make the visit a very special one.as mums not too good on her feet,wanted a very central hotel.saw this on the internet,it looked the business.booked them in for two nights....when we got to the hotel the location was great....then we booked in,we had booked a three bed room as my daughter was staying with them.when we got in the lift all looked great,once we got to our floor and got out of the lift,we knew we had messed up BIG style!!!the grubby walls and general scruffy feal.if that wasnt bad enough,the room was so old and worn,the bedding all faded,the noise from outside was so loud....just need to warn people,all is not what it seems on the photos on line!!!jackie holland

Reviews.Title: “good hotel perfect location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from a 3 night break the hotel is clean and staff freindly locatiion is great and ideal base for all the attractions everything within walking distance but the trams all stop in front of the hotel would stay here again prime location!

Reviews.Title: “Ok, room not as expected but location fantastic”
Reviews.Author: sarah0000
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for a five day break through expedia, mainly based on the description and picture of their superior room. The first room we were offered was tiny and dark, staff quickly offered us the only other room available which was a modest improvement. Both rooms were much smaller than example room on expedia (although we did expect the pic to be of thier best room) and neither had the promised seating area. We paid Â£81 per night and were gald we had paid no more as that would have been dissapointing!! As said by other reviewers if you get a good price and are preapred to accept this hotels little failings it is in a fantastic location for enjoying all Amsterdam has to offer. We found the room clean (if not in need of some refurbishment), comfortable (but on the small side) and quiet and the staff were helpful.

Reviews.Title: “4*? I don't think so”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked two rooms here for two nights in this so called 4* hotel and this is what i got: I managed to get two adjacent rooms which in hindsight seemed like the best thing they did for me. however, one room seemed to be much larger than the other, noticeable by the fact that one of the rooms included a large standing fan and three seats while the other included just one seat as there isn't enough room really for another and no fan. Being about 30 degrees in the summer, no fan is a problem, especially as this 4* has no air conditioning! Among the other problems included an assortment of lights not working in both rooms, and in one of the rooms the switch for the shower/bath was broken too. As other reviews have also said, the non-restriction of the pay-per-view was also very annoying. Overall i think the location was fantastic, but service and quality certainly aren't 4 star, so perhaps better deals can be had in amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, Above Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: markas101
Reviews.Content: For the price this hotel is great for a weekend getaway. Perhaps not 4 star (as the debate rages) but how many 4 star hotels are available in the centre of an amazing city for $150 USD per night. The rooms were small but if you're going to hang out in your room then go to Gent! The breakfast buffett looked amazing but was too steep for me. There is coffee in the room and a fantastic bakery around the corner. Add in the 10 minute walk from the railway station and all in all a very good weekend.'

Reviews.Title: “fine as long as you know what to expect”
Reviews.Author: JE-Whatever
Reviews.Content: No, it's not a 4-star hotel. But if you can get a decent deal on a room, it's got a great location and is just fine. Our room was clean, we got fresh towels etc. every day, and the bathroom was quite nice. Breakfast was fine if not outstanding, and we decided to pay for the convenience. Tips: ask for an interior room. It's not right up against the street, so it's a little quieter. No view, but it seemed like a decent tradeoff since I don't usually gaze out the window of my hotel room while on vacation. Also, we found we had to wedge the window open (it swings open) when we left or the window would close and the room would get stuffy. To sum up: I'd stay there again if the price was right. Overall, we liked the place, but having already visited TripAdvisor, we knew not to expect 4 star accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Definately not a 4 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed in June 2005 - Upon arrival we were given a room which was in an annex to the hotel, although it was small, clean, warm and basic there was a damp smell and the room looked directly into another hotel room window. Noise was constant but expected because of the location. Our rooms were not cleaned on a daily basis and beware of the 'excellent deal for pizza' at night costing 5 euros - which turns into 25 euros because of the service charge. Positives: Good location, friendly staff. Negatives: too expensive for what we got.

Reviews.Title: “Is it a 4 stars hotel ?”
Reviews.Author: fredXIII
Reviews.Content: I've been there for 2 nights in May. The staff was very nice and young, very helpful. The room vas not very clean and we are still asking ourselves why we never had any shampoo or anything in our bathroom. the hotel needs new paints, the corridors and rooms look so old. The continental brreakfast was all right. The location is downtown, near Dam place. Ask for a room behind and not in front of the noisy street. I wouldn't like to talk about pay per view but I have too. 13 â‚¬ for a few minutes, no preview, and no adult control !! Very disapointed about it. certainly wouldn't go in this hotel again. Expensive for the service we had.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Good Food”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We got a special rate via Internet, otherwise I'd say the room was a little small for the price. However, it was comfortable, with spotless bathroom. The trams outside were a little noisy, but given the central location, excusable. Desk staff were all extremely helpful, restaurant food excellent (the traditional pea soup deserves a special mention) and staff good. The staff serving breakfast were all very young and would probably benefit from a little more training, but we were certainly not ignored, unlike one other client's comment I've seen on this web site. We would certainly return.
